Software Engineer II – Full Stack

The Company
Modular Mining Systems is the global leader in mine management technology and a wholly owned subsidiary of Komatsu Ltd. Our innovative technology powers mine operations in every corner of the globe. The products we cultivate, the solutions we engineer and the service we deliver set us apart in the Mining Technology industry. We’re more than a company, we’re a community of passionate, creative professionals striving toward a shared vision: to revolutionize the way the mining industry operates.
With a presence stretching from Johannesburg to Vancouver, Sydney to Lima, you are part of a global brand that supports creativity, fosters innovation and encourages you to think big, share ideas and be yourself.

The Challenges
MineCare Maintenance Management and IoT
The MineCare and IoT team develops the system that is the industry leader on maintenance for mining equipment, Modular MineCare. It is also responsible to develop sensor drivers for hundreds of different interfaces from multiple equipment manufacturers.

MineCare 3 revolutionizes asset management in the mining industry. The real-time system is cloud based, combining the benefits of equipment health monitoring with cloud computing technology and advanced analytics capabilities. This latest version of the industry’s leading asset management system incorporates a vastly improved user experience, with visual tracking location of equipment, fault occurrences, and enhanced data collection. The MineCare 3 solution provides users with the ability to see all data and fault information from their machines in real time, along with satellite image tracking showing exact operating locations.

Systems Architecture
The Systems Architecture team collaborates with Application and Hardware Teams, supporting and evolving the platform that is the base for all our products. Our team's main challenge is to produce high performance and robust software components to handle a very demanding 24/7 mine environment, as well as to research and develop Mobile HW Platforms, such as IoT-like devices and mobile computers. Our team focus on integrating solutions that are aligned with industry trends such as lambda architectures and modern components like ReactJS, ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, Protobuf, Fluentd, Zipkin, Telegraf, InfluxDB, Grafana, etc., in a SoA ecosystem with DevOps principles.

Autonomous Haulage System
The Autonomous Haulage System (AHS) is a comprehensive fleet management system for mines. The autonomous dump truck, jointly developed by Komatsu Ltd., Komatsu America Corp. and Modular Mining Systems, Inc, is centrally controlled through a wireless network that integrates on-board vehicle controllers, high precision global positioning, and obstacle detection and avoidance systems. The system has full supervisory logic that utilizes complex data fusion to control the dump truck to safely operate through a load, haul and dump cycle and allow integration with other mine vehicles such as light vehicles, dozers, loaders, graders.

AHS Product Development team is responsible for crafting innovative solutions to unique and challenging problems. Working with our partners around the world, you will help design and support the next generation of mine planning and optimization technology and build the future platforms and infrastructure that will drive the changes in the mining industry for generations.

ProVision Machine Guidance
ProVision machine guidance solutions use centimeter-precision GPS, mine planning software information, a wireless radio network, and Modular's rugged PTX-C mobile platform to provide continuous guidance to equipment operators on their path to project completion. Key information on the operator's mobile device includes: a map of the work region, local hazards, the equipment's real-time position, and continuous updates to project requirements. This information enables operators to work safely and efficiently, day or night, and helps your mine achieve lower cost per ton.

Responsibilities
Each day will present you with new challenges and opportunities to test and grow your skills. As a full stack developer in Modular, you will be responsible for the following:
Producing and maintaining high quality, tested and efficient code, following industry standards.
Developing proof of concepts for new, innovative solutions.
Performing analysis, estimating work, creating and updating software architecture and design.
Understanding Modular applications domain and pro-actively interacting with product teams to improve functional and nonfunctional aspects of platform components.
Providing technical oversight to development teams and contractors in subject area.
Required Skills
BSc in Computer Science or equivalent
1-5 years of shown experience in Software Development
Strong coding skills in at least one major object-oriented language (C#, Java, C++)
Core programming knowledge on multi-threading, garbage collector.
Proven problem-solving ability and attention to details
Desired Skills
Demonstrated knowledge of software engineering best-practices, patterns and anti-patterns
Strong written and interpersonal skills, ability to effectively interact with local and offshore development teams.
Strong analytical skills, experience with domain modeling and requirement elicitation
Experience with databases modeling and ORM frameworks
Good knowledge of computer networking and the TCP/IP stack
Experience with Web Technologies such as HTML, CSS and Javascript
Solid grasp of performance-critical, real-time, highly available and distributed systems
Experience with some of the industry standard frameworks, such as ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Protobuf, Fluentd, OpenTracing, Zipkin, Telegraf, Prometheus, Envoy, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.

Strength in Trust


Our goal at OneTrust is to bring the power of trust to companies all over the world. Using cutting-edge technology and a real-world approach to ethics, compliance, privacy, security, and third-party risk, we've created a no-nonsense platform to help supercharge the global push for trust.

Our Commitment to You


When you join OneTrust you are stepping onto a launching pad — the countdown has begun. The destination? A career without boundaries working alongside a diverse and inclusive crew who is passionate about doing meaningful work. As a pioneer, your voice and expertise will help chart the direction of an entirely new industry — Trust. Our commitment to putting people first starts with you. Your growth is part of the mission. Job Title: Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer
Job Description:
Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer*
BID Group*
Location: South Eastern US*
The BID Group of Companies is a North American leader in the design, manufacture and support of World Class equipment, services and turnkey solutions for the solid wood processing industry. BID Group serves primarily the North American market and offers the most comprehensive range of products available, producing everything from mechanical equipment and control systems to optimization systems equipped with digital machine vision and AI technology. The company integrates its products & technology to deliver fully automated production lines. BID Group has over 1500 employees working in our many divisions located around North America.

The OPER8 offering is an Industrial Internet of Things (IoT) platform with custom BID-designed architecture centered around PTC ThingWorx that connects to operations and business/IT data sources and orchestrates the data to drive efficiency, reliability, and uptime in our customer’s operations through the use of data visualization, data analytics, and custom IoT applications.

The Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer is a highly motivated professional working with the OPER8 team. As a key member of the team, the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying various end to end production, throughput, asset health and quality control solutions for our customers. The successful candidate must be technically inclined and willing and able to learn new technologies as they are required. We’re a small but growing team of highly motivated professionals that feed on results. We strive to create a fun, flexible and rewarding work environment.

Responsibilities Include:
Deploying data connectivity software and customized Edge programming on-premise.
Working extensively with the cloud based IIoT platform to deploy and develop offerings.
Configuring cloud databases.
Building and QA of queries for KPI development and dashboarding.
Preparing design documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
Contributing to the product development team by staying up to date on disruptive, breakthrough technologies and processes.
Working closely with customer reliability engineers, data analysts, electrical/automation groups, and management.
Ensuring customer satisfaction and foster loyalty to the BID Group.
Skills and Qualifications
Background and/or education in one of the following: electrical or software engineering or computer science or 4+ years of relevant work experience.
2+ years of experience with programming languages: Javascript, Python, Java, C or Shell.
2+ years of experience with databases is required: TSDBs, SQL variants or Mongo, TICK stack experience preferred.
Familiarity with communication protocols and web standards: HTTP, Websocket, REST, RPC, KepServerEx, CIP, OPC, Ethernet/IP, MQTT.
Understanding of OOP or other programming models: composition, inheritance, polymorphism, async, flow inversion of control.
Allen Bradley ControlLogix system knowledge is beneficial, but training is provided as required.
PTC ThingWorx knowledge is beneficial, but training is provided as required.
IT/computer networking skills are an asset: LANs, subnets, troubleshooting communication issues.
Methodical, able to pay close attention to detail, and possess excellent communication skills.
Flexibility in learning new technologies, often independently and under pressure.
Able to work independently and be results driven.

Software Engineer II – Full Stack

The Company
Modular Mining Systems is the global leader in mine management technology and a wholly owned subsidiary of Komatsu Ltd. Our innovative technology powers mine operations in every corner of the globe. The products we cultivate, the solutions we engineer and the service we deliver set us apart in the Mining Technology industry. We’re more than a company, we’re a community of passionate, creative professionals striving toward a shared vision: to revolutionize the way the mining industry operates.
With a presence stretching from Johannesburg to Vancouver, Sydney to Lima, you are part of a global brand that supports creativity, fosters innovation and encourages you to think big, share ideas and be yourself.

The Challenges
MineCare Maintenance Management and IoT
The MineCare and IoT team develops the system that is the industry leader on maintenance for mining equipment, Modular MineCare. It is also responsible to develop sensor drivers for hundreds of different interfaces from multiple equipment manufacturers.

MineCare 3 revolutionizes asset management in the mining industry. The real-time system is cloud based, combining the benefits of equipment health monitoring with cloud computing technology and advanced analytics capabilities. This latest version of the industry’s leading asset management system incorporates a vastly improved user experience, with visual tracking location of equipment, fault occurrences, and enhanced data collection. The MineCare 3 solution provides users with the ability to see all data and fault information from their machines in real time, along with satellite image tracking showing exact operating locations.

Systems Architecture
The Systems Architecture team collaborates with Application and Hardware Teams, supporting and evolving the platform that is the base for all our products. Our team's main challenge is to produce high performance and robust software components to handle a very demanding 24/7 mine environment, as well as to research and develop Mobile HW Platforms, such as IoT-like devices and mobile computers. Our team focus on integrating solutions that are aligned with industry trends such as lambda architectures and modern components like ReactJS, ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, Protobuf, Fluentd, Zipkin, Telegraf, InfluxDB, Grafana, etc., in a SoA ecosystem with DevOps principles.

Autonomous Haulage System
The Autonomous Haulage System (AHS) is a comprehensive fleet management system for mines. The autonomous dump truck, jointly developed by Komatsu Ltd., Komatsu America Corp. and Modular Mining Systems, Inc, is centrally controlled through a wireless network that integrates on-board vehicle controllers, high precision global positioning, and obstacle detection and avoidance systems. The system has full supervisory logic that utilizes complex data fusion to control the dump truck to safely operate through a load, haul and dump cycle and allow integration with other mine vehicles such as light vehicles, dozers, loaders, graders.

AHS Product Development team is responsible for crafting innovative solutions to unique and challenging problems. Working with our partners around the world, you will help design and support the next generation of mine planning and optimization technology and build the future platforms and infrastructure that will drive the changes in the mining industry for generations.

ProVision Machine Guidance
ProVision machine guidance solutions use centimeter-precision GPS, mine planning software information, a wireless radio network, and Modular's rugged PTX-C mobile platform to provide continuous guidance to equipment operators on their path to project completion. Key information on the operator's mobile device includes: a map of the work region, local hazards, the equipment's real-time position, and continuous updates to project requirements. This information enables operators to work safely and efficiently, day or night, and helps your mine achieve lower cost per ton.

Responsibilities
Each day will present you with new challenges and opportunities to test and grow your skills. As a full stack developer in Modular, you will be responsible for the following:
Producing and maintaining high quality, tested and efficient code, following industry standards.
Developing proof of concepts for new, innovative solutions.
Performing analysis, estimating work, creating and updating software architecture and design.
Understanding Modular applications domain and pro-actively interacting with product teams to improve functional and nonfunctional aspects of platform components.
Providing technical oversight to development teams and contractors in subject area.
Required Skills
BSc in Computer Science or equivalent
1-5 years of shown experience in Software Development
Strong coding skills in at least one major object-oriented language (C#, Java, C++)
Core programming knowledge on multi-threading, garbage collector.
Proven problem-solving ability and attention to details
Desired Skills
Demonstrated knowledge of software engineering best-practices, patterns and anti-patterns
Strong written and interpersonal skills, ability to effectively interact with local and offshore development teams.
Strong analytical skills, experience with domain modeling and requirement elicitation
Experience with databases modeling and ORM frameworks
Good knowledge of computer networking and the TCP/IP stack
Experience with Web Technologies such as HTML, CSS and Javascript
Solid grasp of performance-critical, real-time, highly available and distributed systems
Experience with some of the industry standard frameworks, such as ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Protobuf, Fluentd, OpenTracing, Zipkin, Telegraf, Prometheus, Envoy, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.

The Company:
Placements.io is changing the way digital media publishers manage their advertising businesses. Our SaaS platform makes advertising sales, operations, billing and revenue reporting painless for digital media publishers and eCommerce.

In an increasingly fragmented ad tech landscape, Placements understands the importance of creating a connected ecosystem for its customers, who depend on Placements to help them scale. A product-first company, Placements is engineering focused and the team is comprised of industry leading talent from Amazon, Microsoft, Salesforce.com, FreeWheel, Operative, AppNexus, and OpenX.

Headquartered in Seattle where Placements.io was founded, the company launched its New York office in early 2018. We have plans to expand to London in Q1 2019.

You're passionate about the latest web-tech trends, as well as eager to write custom CSS animations by hand. You absolutely love delighting our customers with new features that you've meticulously written to be bullet-proof. Writing async scalable multi-item list-filters all-day is nbd but fun at the same time.

2020-044-EGR: UI Software Engineer

Directorate Engineering & Support Solutions
Location Wright-Patterson AFB, OH
Riverside Research has an immediate opening at Wright-Patterson AFB, Ohio for a UI Software Engineer.

The UI Software Engineer will be part of a team of geographically distributed UI developers in improving the usability and capabilities of the UI for a computational physics tool developed by the US Government.

Built using web technologies (HTML5, WebGL, Google Protocol Buffers, etc.), the UI supports the construction and attribution of computer aided design (CAD) geometries, manages simulation execution, and displays post-processing visualizations. Primarily deployed to the desktop while interfacing with a C++ backend server, the tool is positioned for future deployment over the web. Candidates will ideally have experience in both types of deployment.

All Riverside Research opportunities require U.S. citizenship.

Job Responsibilities:
•Collaborate with the team to design and implement new features in the user interface and backend
•Interface with expert users to understand their requirements
•Apply User Experience (UX) best-practices to improve the usability of the software
•Develop UI software using HTML and JavaScript and its language extensions
•Develop server/backend software as a hybrid of C++ and Python
•Review similar applications and identify best practices that can be utilized in the product
•Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:
• Ability to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
• Experience in UI/UX software Web development using such tools as JavaScript, Angular, Node, Restful APIs, or similar.
• Experience with compiled languages, such as C++, C, Java, C#, or similar
• Development experience on Windows and Linux systems including development of shell scripts
• Experience with revision control systems and managing requirements within an issue tracking system

Desired Qualifications:
• Experience combining web client and server backend components into a single thick client application using tools such as Chromium Embedded Framework, Electron.js, or similar
• Experience with full stack development, design, and review
• Experience with 3D rendering libraries such as X3D, three.js, WebGL, OpenGL, or similar
• Experience working in projects comprising >100,000 source lines of code
• Familiarity with CAD systems like AutoCAD, SolidWorks, etc
• Experience developing with interpreted languages and numerical libraries such as Python and numpy
• Ability to produce data visualizations in scripted plotting tools such as matplotlib

Job Title: Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer
Job Description:
Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer*
BID Group*
Location: South Eastern US*
The BID Group of Companies is a North American leader in the design, manufacture and support of World Class equipment, services and turnkey solutions for the solid wood processing industry. BID Group serves primarily the North American market and offers the most comprehensive range of products available, producing everything from mechanical equipment and control systems to optimization systems equipped with digital machine vision and AI technology. The company integrates its products & technology to deliver fully automated production lines. BID Group has over 1500 employees working in our many divisions located around North America.

The OPER8 offering is an Industrial Internet of Things (IoT) platform with custom BID-designed architecture centered around PTC ThingWorx that connects to operations and business/IT data sources and orchestrates the data to drive efficiency, reliability, and uptime in our customer’s operations through the use of data visualization, data analytics, and custom IoT applications.

The Industrial IoT System Integration Developer / Engineer is a highly motivated professional working with the OPER8 team. As a key member of the team, the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying various end to end production, throughput, asset health and quality control solutions for our customers. The successful candidate must be technically inclined and willing and able to learn new technologies as they are required. We’re a small but growing team of highly motivated professionals that feed on results. We strive to create a fun, flexible and rewarding work environment.

Responsibilities Include:
Deploying data connectivity software and customized Edge programming on-premise.
Working extensively with the cloud based IIoT platform to deploy and develop offerings.
Configuring cloud databases.
Building and QA of queries for KPI development and dashboarding.
Preparing design documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
Contributing to the product development team by staying up to date on disruptive, breakthrough technologies and processes.
Working closely with customer reliability engineers, data analysts, electrical/automation groups, and management.
Ensuring customer satisfaction and foster loyalty to the BID Group.
Skills and Qualifications
Background and/or education in one of the following: electrical or software engineering or computer science or 4+ years of relevant work experience.
2+ years of experience with programming languages: Javascript, Python, Java, C or Shell.
2+ years of experience with databases is required: TSDBs, SQL variants or Mongo, TICK stack experience preferred.
Familiarity with communication protocols and web standards: HTTP, Websocket, REST, RPC, KepServerEx, CIP, OPC, Ethernet/IP, MQTT.
Understanding of OOP or other programming models: composition, inheritance, polymorphism, async, flow inversion of control.
Allen Bradley ControlLogix system knowledge is beneficial, but training is provided as required.
PTC ThingWorx knowledge is beneficial, but training is provided as required.
IT/computer networking skills are an asset: LANs, subnets, troubleshooting communication issues.
Methodical, able to pay close attention to detail, and possess excellent communication skills.
Flexibility in learning new technologies, often independently and under pressure.
Able to work independently and be results driven.

Job Title: Cloud Software Engineer (TS with Poly Required)
Job Description:
Do you enjoy working in an environment that uses leading technologies in a fast paced environment? You will be developing prototypes answering new questions as well as providing better answers to existing questions Working in a variety of environments, the successful candidate will use leading edge technologies to develop analytics pulling data from multiple cyber sources, as well as classic SIGINT. These analytics will be used in standard presentation systems throughout the enterprise to support missions throughout the world covering a variety of subjects.. There are also opportunities to evaluate and work with new leading edge platforms, frameworks and technologies, all while working directly with the customer in a highly collaborative, integrated environment.

Developing answers to questions via Java Map/Reduce, making them available via the corporate tool suites
Opportunities to research and work with multiple platforms for development
Working in a cohesive, small team environment

At least five (5) years of general experience in software development/engineering, including requirements analysis, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and problem diagnosis/resolution.
At least three (3) years of experience developing software with high level languages (such as Java, C, C++), developing software in UNIX/Linux (RedHat versions 3-5+), and software integration and testing (to include developing and implementing test plans and scripts).

Shall have demonstrated work experience with 1) Serialization such as JSON and/or BSON, 2) developing restful services, and 3) using source code management tools.

Job Title: Lead Software Engineer - Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning System
Job Description:
Celestial Oncology Inc. is a startup developing a novel robotic system to delivery 4π radiotherapy, which promises to dramatically improve the dose distribution in radiation therapy treatments. The company is in Santa Monica, California. Celestial recently completed its series A financing and is beginning the development of the system to take it through FDA 510(k) approval. The Senior Robotics System Engineer will be responsible for the design and development of the system level robotics controls for the treatment robot and imaging robot. This responsibility also includes test and evaluation of the functional prototype, supporting integration of the robotics system with the treatment planning software, formal testing and submissions. The Senior Robotics System Engineer will work in a supportive environment provided by both an established company and a major research university.

The responsibilities include:
Lead the design, development and integration of the control systems for the treatment robot (linac) and imaging robot. This includes obstacle avoidance sensor.
Development of motion planning and integration with the TPS software development team.
Design of the registration & tracking system with the robot workspace.
Responsible for the repeatability and accuracy of the robotic system.
Responsible for designing the robot system to work in a collaborative workspace.
Documentation of the robotic system including requirements, risk analysis, system design verification, validation and reliability testing of the robotic system in support of an FDA 510(k) submission.
The requirements include:
Bachelors in EE, ME or CS. Master's degree a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in medical robotics and image-based algorithm development.
Strong track record in the areas of image-based registration of robotic workspace, motion planning and autonomous systems including forward and inverse kinematic development.
Familiarity with ISO 13485 and ISO 14971; Working in an FDA regulated environment is a must.
Theoretical and practical knowledge of classical and modern servo control systems.
Able to compute forward and inverse kinematics on multi-DOF robotic systems.
Matlab and C++ programming skills a must; embedded C programming capabilities is a nice to have.
Solidworks, Autocad Inventor or other solid modeling programs a nice to have.
Knowledge of and experience with robotic platforms or other real-time systems is required.
Passion for learning and finding the root cause of complex technical problems.

At PSAI, our Front End Developers develop state-of-the-art artificially intelligent software tools that help fuel the extremely important field of digital marketing. If you are a self-motivated individual, eager to consult our UX/UI team on the best and most up to date designs for our software, while leading the direction of how they are built and how they are maintained, then please, read on.
Responsibilities
As a Front End Developer and ultimately our bridge between visual designers, back end developers, and all things marketing you will be:
Building user interfaces for a multitude of innovative SaaS and AI learning tools for Spectrum’s software tools
Consulting with New Product Development team members to determine what technologies should be utilized to build our newest products
Developing the interface of mobile and desktop applications
Creating custom solutions for our software tool platforms
Build responsive web tools and seamlessly integrate motion into our interfaces utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other programs as you see fit
Working alongside designers, production experts, web developers, and creative professionals to develop lasting solutions for our clients
Collaborate with back end developers during requirement building phase
Work with back end developers to move project along in production via sprints
Some Characteristics That Define You
As a Front End Developer, you know that your job is much more than graphic design, web development, or creative alone. You are an artist, an engineer, and multitude of other things which make you the stellar developer that you are. As such, here are just a few traits that define our Front End Developers here at Spectrum:
Developers. Design is a unique opportunity to combine the artistry and creativity of the web with the functionality and logic of a scientist and an inventor. Our front-end developers are design engineers just as much as they are artists.
Detail-Oriented. White space and themed projects are some of our best friends in the design and development department. We love to see a site come perfectly together and we know you hate to see tiny details and bad Photoshop jobs ruin a beautiful project.
Visionaries. One of the things we love about design here at Spectrum is that it’s constantly evolving. Whether you are working on a new internal software platform or innovative new client site, we are always looking for ways to improve our products and increase your knowledge base as a developer.
Curious. As developers and digital marketers, we have the unique opportunity to create interactive and functional pieces of art. As developers, we’re not only proud of those projects but curious why some are more successful than others and seek to understand which designs work best.
Business-Savvy. Beyond the wicked front end development skills you bring to the table, we also want you to consider the business implications of our websites and software tools. From the ways our team will use them to how our clients and their customers will interact with our sites, we always want you to keep the user and the business application in mind.
Required Skills and Experience
As a Front End Developer at Spectrum, you will have the ability to hone your craft and advance your core skillset; but before we can do that, here are just a few of the skills and experience you should have coming in:
A bachelor’s degree/pursuing a bachelor's degree in design, computer science, information, or a related field
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with HTML and CSS
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with Javascript/JQuery
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience in desktop, mobile and responsive web design
Exposure to and experience with React
Experience/familiarity with .Net/MVC/Razor and Microsoft Azure
Ability to explain and translate your work to those under you as well as in different departments
Acute eye for detail
Benefits
Being the dynamite Front End Developer that you are, we understand that in order to get the creative juices flowing you need a good work-life-play balance. To make sure that’s possible this full-time position comes with a highly competitive salary and unparalleled benefits including:
Comprehensive medical & dental insurance
Retirement planning & company matching
Remote working options
Generous PTO, including sick days & holidays
A state-of-the-art office environment
Nintendo Switch in-office gaming such as FIFA, Arms, Mario Kart, and Rocket League
Year-round gym memberships
Paid continuing education
Casual dress code
Flexible scheduling

Ag-Analytics Technology Company, LLC. Job Description - Senior Front End Web Developer and Engineers, Full Time*
We are seeking high energy, creative Senior Front End Web Developers and Engineers to join our team at Ag-Analytics (analytics.ag) to develop cutting edge tools and predictive analytics in digital agriculture.

The successful candidate will have extensive experience leading commercial software development efforts. Primary activities will involve development and maintenance of our web apps, including coordinating UX & design, testing and deploying web solutions in collaboration with our data scientists and researchers. Building on our extensive existing platform, you will design and build out web based tools, creating easy-to-use interfaces for user-driven data analysis and visualization.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or similar; 5-8 years’ experience or equivalent. Masters in computer science preferred.
Extensive experience in building commercial applications and web development, design, and/or programming in .NET/C#, HTML/CSS, MVC, JavaScript, React, and React Native. GitHub a must. Experience with GIS a big plus. Leaflet and other web mapping experience preferred.
Mobile app design and/or development experience
Ability to design, code, test, debug, and develop tools and documentation, and maintain complex programs, systems and web applications. Ability to formulate, define system scope and objectives to develop or modify complex software systems.
Ability to organize project teams and direct project activities and document phases of projects, and working with contractors. Plan and coordinate development efforts and deployments.
Positive attitude and willingness to problem-solve in a startup environment. Conscientiousness and reliability.
Familiarity with analytical modeling approaches and related software a plus.
Strong interpersonal, organization and project management skills, and ability to work as part of a diverse team and independently, while contributing to a high-quality and respectful work environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively to colleagues and end-users.
Ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment with changing priorities. Ability to help establish realistic goals and deliver work on schedule.
Previous experience in agricultural or environmental applications is not required but preferred. Familiarity with insurance, finance, and risk management applications a plus.
Self-starter with ability to work creatively to solve problems and identify opportunities as they arise.
Ability to handle confidential information.
A willingness and ability to learn new modeling and programming skills in a multi-disciplinary setting is a must.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques (e.g., artificial neural networks, etc.) in real-world applications and knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, spatial statistics) and experience with applications are a big plus.
About Ag-Analytics

Feeding the world is a simultaneously complex and urgent mission with millions of fields, billions of acres and stakeholders. Ag-Analytics® is a farm analytics platform that specializes in the analysis of precision ag data, remote satellite analytics and risk management. Through its flagship profit mapping product, Profit Layers, it provides advanced insights to growers through precision ag integrations with John Deere Operations Center and Climate FieldView. Our tools, analytics and research spans a wide variety of areas in environmental modeling, risk management, geospatial analysis, agricultural finance, actuarial modeling and policy, serving a wide variety of clients. We offer competitive salaries and an attractive incentive program. For more information about Ag-Analytics visit https://analytics.ag.

Job Description

Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us in our Cambridge, MA office.

At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.

For the Takeda global scientific community who aspire to deliver transformative medicines to patients Scientific Informatics is the technology leader, with domain specific expertise, that provides innovative platforms and technologies to improve both operational efficiency and data-driven decision making. As an embedded partner Scientific Informatics is at the leading edge of both science and technology and proactively reacts to the changing scientific environment and needs of researchers in an agile fashion to deliver timely, value-adding solutions.

The Digital Advisory Board programs aim to ensure our growing data is easily accessible to everyone so we can help our patients and HCPs faster and more effectively.

OBJECTIVES/PURPOSE

Maintain and develop digital products (client facing application side) and continuously delivers product enhancements.
Transforms design and product vision into working product.
Uses agile engineering practices and various software and Web development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that enhance the customer and employee experience.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

Collaborate with other agile team members to craft clear user stories, design tests for prototypes and products, and continuously deliver product enhancements.
Create interfaces between micro-services and graphical surface.
Define and maintain coding standards, and guide team members to comply with them.
Lead the creation of technical design documents and lead the communication of the architectural vision across functional areas.
Work with a small team to ensure product delivery and best engineering practices.

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, or relevant work experience
Experience working with and refactoring existing code
Extensive experience with full stack development in a large enterprise environment
Technical experience in related technologies
Related pharmaceutical or pharmaceutical consulting work
Experience demonstrating a high degree of proficiency in designing and developing complex, high-quality solutions
Experience working in a team utilizing an agile approach
Strong analytical, problem solving skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-starter with excellent interpersonal, motivational, and facilitation skills
Strong, proven problem-solving skills with the ability to quickly analyze the most expedient method to recover business operations
Must be committed to a culture of continuous improvement
Exceptional customer service skills, in addition to extensive experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Must be able to communicate effectively with users, executives and senior leaders at all levels
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks
Passionate about technology
Able to develop and maintain effective working relationships with individuals with both technical and non-technical staff

Kin + Carta is looking for an experienced C# Web Developer to join our team on a contract basis. We are seeking someone with advanced web development experience as well as exposure to mobile application development. You will be working on client-facing projects within Fortune 1000 companies in the enterprise software space. You will be given the opportunity to innovate using the latest technology trends.

Ability to consult with clients, a servant leadership attitude, a love of learning and an analytical mind are a must.

Building enterprise web and mobile applications.

About Kin + Carta

Kin + Carta exists to make the world work better by delivering transformative digital growth for our clients. As a digital transformation firm, we apply creativity, data, and technology to help clients invent, market, and operate new digital products and services that turn prospects into customers, and customers into advocates. Kin + Carta seamlessly integrates the strategic consulting, software engineering, and marketing technology needed to help businesses 'Make It Happen'.

Consultants at Kin + Carta have the opportunity to: engage with the most cutting-edge emerging technologies, solve difficult problems for some of the world's biggest companies, and work within a breadth of industries.

Kin + Carta is headquartered in Chicago and London with offices across four continents. Our culture and shared ways of working unite us globally, but it's our diverse specialisms, our connections, and our courage that makes our firm a recognized best place to work.

We welcome our Kin to show up as their full selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Job Title: Lead Software Developer - Directed Energy Applications
Job Description:
About Us Established in 1981, SURVICE Engineering is a nationally recognized, single-source engineering service provider for Government and Industry organizations involved in all phases of the systems engineering process. We're proud to have supported the development, testing, and analysis of many of the major U.S. combat systems in the field today.

SURVICE Engineering is seeking a Lead Software Developer to provide support for our Navy and Air Force customers working on directed energy initiatives. This SW Developer will work with our Laser Software Research Team including subject matter experts and methodology developers in analyzing new functional requirements, developing new models, and maintaining and enhancing existing models. This individual will work with a software development team including subject matter experts and project managers in analyzing new functional requirements while providing feasibility assessments and level of effort.

Work Location

Albuquerque, NM or Socorro, NM

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

Collaborates with other software developers to analyze, estimate, design, and implement features, potentially taking a leadership position
Participates in planning meetings and technical coordination meetings for reporting issues, planning, and providing status
C++11, C++17 standards
Works with subject matter experts and project managers in analyzing new functional requirements while providing feasibility assessments and level of effort
Follows the team's software development process and procedures. When directed, peer review fellow software developer's code and documentation to ensure it meets team's quality standards and best practices
Works with software architectural owners to ensure all development meets architectural vision and system designs
Works with lead software engineer and senior developers in deriving technical requirements from functional requirements
Contributes to technical design documentation and maintenance of the software

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or Engineering with at least 4 years of experience in development of scientific application software. Alternatively, a Master's or other advance degree with experience in software development.

Experience with C++ is required. Additional experience with other languages, such as C, FORTRAN, or Python is desirable
Experience in working on a software development team
Solid coding practices including design, unit testing, and revision control
C++11, C++17 standards

Security Clearance Requirement

Ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense Security Clearance. MUST BE A US CITIZEN

Yellowbrick Data is a rapidly growing Enterprise Data Warehouse start-up headquartered in Palo Alto, CA (near the California Avenue Caltrain station) with offices also in London, United Kingdom and Salt Lake City, UT. We've been growing over 3x year-on-year and our technology is used by the world's largest insurers, credit card companies, telco's, healthcare and marketers. Our customers love our product: Most are repeat buyers and in many cases we've become the new standard for analytics and data warehousing in their respective enterprises. Yellowbrick is well funded having raised $173m from top-tier venture firms.

You will report to the Director of Software Development, and work with the rest of our development and engineering staff. While we are specifically looking for a front-end web developer, you will have the opportunity to work many areas of the software stack for our database appliance, which includes almost every aspect of Computer Science from operating systems to user interface and everything in between. If you think you understand what "full stack" means, consider we're talking about custom, hyper-converged hardware, operating systems, drivers, executor, planner and database front-end, the protocols that an end-user utilizes to query data, the tools that provide access, the integrated management, and the web access. The stack is both vertically oriented and horizontally accessible through a huge array of access protocols and integration to the world of big data.

Our product has an advanced user interface built on a modern web framework. We are constantly evolving its capabilities, and our use of innovative visualizations built on D3, Vue.js, angular.js and other modern HTML5 technologies really drive value to our customers. Providing understanding how database workloads run and perform on a massively scalable MPP cluster is one mission; administering and controlling resources for the cluster is another.

If you love the challenge of providing first-class visualization and tools, love the power of the modern browser, yearn to build something truly different and powerful, we have the place for you. We value collaboration, courtesy, and have a work hard/play hard culture. We offer a rewarding environment in which you will work with a peer group that is technically bright and fearless in taking on hard challenges.

RESPONSIBILITES
Help lead the design and evolution of Yellowbrick's web user interface
Research, prototype and implement new ways to visualize information
Debug and enhance existing functionality
Lead design discussions
Make design contributions outside of your primary area
Help troubleshoot issues encountered in the field
QUALIFICATIONS
Proficiency with Vue.js, angular.js and ES6
Familiarity with CSS frameworks such as Bulma, Bootstrap or Material
Experience with SVG, canvas, charting and graph visualization
Experience with relational database technology; one or more of SQL, NoSQL and GraphQL
Experience with Java is a plus
Understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
3+ years of experience developing software that users are successfully running in production
Experience with the node/npm/component ecosystem and build infrastructure
Experience with the cycle of design, development and customer release
Experience with Big Data and BI tools a plus

About SugarCRM, Inc.
SugarCRM is a customer experience (CX) leader enabling businesses to create profitable customer relationships by delivering highly relevant, personalized experiences throughout the customer journey. We empower companies to strengthen existing customer relationships, create new ones through actionable insights and intelligent automation and better understand the customer at every stage of the journey. This enables businesses to accelerate demand generation, grow revenue, deliver superior customer care and increase loyalty. Our easy-to-use, intuitive platform makes customer experience easy and accessible for everyone, allowing marketing, sales and services professionals to focus on high-impact, value-adding activities that create customers for life.

Where do you fit?
As a Frontend Engineer you will play a critical hands-on role responsible for managing execution related to the design, development and delivery of our next generation user interface and experience. This role requires someone with significant experience with Javascript frameworks (e.g. Angular or Bootstrap) that has worked with web-based applications.

Impact you will make in the role:
Develop, configure, debug, secure, and deploy high performance web applications. Code, test, debug, implement, document, and develop programs
Participate in functional requirements and design documentation. Work closely with the Product and UX team to iterate designs, shaping.
UI requirements: Perform quality testing in collaboration with Quality Assurance staff to identify and correct defects. Analyze existing code base and identify opportunities for performance improvements through re-factoring and/or re-design. Well-organized and process driven to ensure effective delivery.

What you will need to succeed:
2+ years with the following technologies: JQuery, Angular8, Bootstrap, or similar. 2+ years front-end development skills (HTML/CSS/JavaScript). Successful track record producing web applications and working with RESTful web services. Familiar with Agile or other rapid application development methods. Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and to articulate solutions. Ability to think abstractly and deal with problems. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and help the team be successful. Highly organized with excellent communication skills. Four year university/college degree required - preferably in Computer Science (or related).

Bonus if you have:
Proficiency with .NET, Java, or Python
Knowledge of Google’s Material Design principles or other usability practices
A strong sense of aesthetic and design
Experience with marketing applications (email marketing, landing page & nurture design)
Software as a Service platform experience
Experience with the RESTful/ HATEOAS style of SOA

Location: Atlanta, GA

Engineering Team Culture:
Our focus is building out teams with smart engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to build software for our unique solutions in the CRM (customer relationship management) space. At SugarCRM, you'll have the chance to work on various teams and stacks. Here's more:
Communication and collaboration is key to our processes, and we don't want to hinder it with walls.
We are passionate about automated testing to deliver a high level of quality to our customers.
We use a Scrum-based development methodology that includes daily stand-ups, regular Sprint reviews, and retrospectives to discuss. We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible product.
As a part of our company culture, we encourage everyone to work at a healthy, sustainable pace.
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

- Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans including 401(k) match

- Regular social events
- Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an immediate impact
- We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career

Overview


Everyone wants to work with people they respect. Even better if you can work with a company you respect. We have both at The David J. Joseph Company, and a 135+ year track record on operating an ethical business with a positive work culture. It may sound cliché, but it’s true. We’re a big, global company that still feels small.

Working at the David J. Joseph Company is unique. We offer employment in diverse settings such as traditional corporate headquarters, dynamic sales locations, and scrap recycling facilities. This workplace diversity gives our employees the variety they crave and the exposure to a global business. A career at The David J. Joseph Company is ideal for self-starters seeking to make an impact on our company and their careers.

The David J. Joseph Company (DJJ), founded in 1885, is a world leader in scrap metal recycling & trading. With over 80+ locations, the Joseph Company is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Nucor Corporation (NUE) a Fortune 200 Company.

Responsibilities
Develops routine to moderately complex proprietary software programming applications from concept to deployment by gathering and evaluating requirements, defining business information requirements, designing the solution, building the code, and testing to meet or exceed quality standards using established process methodologies and tools.

Participates in the testing process through test review and analysis, test witnessing and certification of software. Debugs applications as problems are identified.
Makes recommendations for business process improvements with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the technology needs.
Collaborates with Project Managers / Business Analysts and end-users to define and document requirements using established processes and tools and given scope constraints.
Translates requirements to design, architect and document systems, and write code that is stable, reusable, scalable and simple.
Proactively monitors, maintains and enhances existing systems to increase functionality, optimize performance, keep pace with changing business needs and reflect technology advancements.
Develops and maintains knowledge of customer's business by learning through a mix of project work, partnering with business users, and seeking out learning opportunities.
Resolves internal customer’s complaints and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.
Works with technical staff to understand routine to moderately complex problems with software and develops specifications to resolve them.
Solves routine to moderately complex business needs with initiative, sound judgment, strong technical skill, attention to detail, and exceptional customer service.
May participate in indoctrinating interns and / or new employees.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business or related discipline. Equivalent combination of experience and education will also be considered.
Minimum 2 – 5 years related experience in designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting, maintaining and deploying web-based, multi-tiered business software solutions.
Experience designing, developing and optimizing MS SQL databases.
Strong debugging, troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Minimum 1 year experience in the following technologies: C#, ASP.NET, MS SQL, HTML, JavaScript, CSS.
Ability to perform moderately complex requirements development, coverage analysis, impact analysis and modification.
Ability to lead requirements effort on routine to moderately complex projects.
Demonstrates working knowledge, practical skills and the ability to perform work under moderate supervision.
Must be detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple assignments effectively.
Requires effective communication skills to convey status, ideas and concepts in a team environment.
Requires a professional demeanor with a high degree of flexibility, responsiveness and self-direction.
Non-routine issues are often discussed with / referred to more experienced staff.
Work is typically focused on short-term objectives (6 months or less) and reviewed frequently for assessment and direction.
Minimal travel required.

We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package including paid training, bonus program, medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverage, vacation, paid holidays, a 401(k) plan with match, tuition reimbursement and other great benefits.

The Web Application Developer manages the Programming and Analysis department including developing project plans from internal requests and implementing those plans from initial concept to full production. The department runs primarily on ad-hoc requests with a wide variety of skills necessary to implement the associated projects. The Web Application Developer must be versatile and excellent at time management. A typical week involves:

Meeting with the CEO and VPO to discuss priorities, statuses of current projects and any requests for new projects
Meeting with outside software vendors to discuss any necessary implementation, customization or integrations
Aiding in the implementation, customization and integrations for third-party software

Supporting business decision making processes through analytical analysis of available options
Full-stack programming of any requested web applications

Developing data visualizations and reports for ad-hoc or continual business analysis

Experience maintaining company software suite including implementing customizations and integrations

Experience with Microsoft Excel including writing custom VBA add-ins

· Analyze product usage, identify areas to improve user experience and adoption

EXTRA CREDIT

OnlineLabels.com Front-End Developer

OnlineLabels.com is an award-winning online retailer of blank and custom labels. Located in Central Florida, we offer a fast, casual, and fun work environment. We care about our team and we're passionate about helping our customers' businesses succeed.

Role

We are currently seeking a creative and talented Front-End Developer to help build effective pages & applications for our e-commerce site. In this role, you will be working closely with our existing front-end web development team and our back-end software development team to optimize the users' shopping experience.

We are looking for a candidate who can create a highly dynamic web experience from start to finish. You will be a part of the brainstorming sessions with our development and marketing teams to come up with the direction and vision for each page. Due to the wide range of projects you will be involved in, there will be lots of opportunity for growth of not only your front-end development skills, but also broader marketing skills and concepts.

Required Skills

Strong knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3
Proficient at Javascript and Javascript MVC Frameworks (Vue / React)
Experienced in optimizing Javascript for page speed and client-side performance
Experience in writing cross-browser compatible code (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, etc.)
Experience in planning and building responsive sites compatible across all devices
Familiarity with Javascript build tools (Webpack / Gulp)
Familiarity with the concepts of version control (SVN / Git)
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Intermediate writing skills

Nice-to-Haves

Basic familiarity with .NET / .NET Core environments
Experience with Search Engine Optimization
Experience developing for e-commerce sites
Experience collaborating on Agile / SCRUM Teams
Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite / Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)

Desired Traits

A love of user experience and excellent attention to detail
The ability to clearly conceptualize, demonstrate, and execute ideas
Passion for technology and writing clean, efficient code
Self-motivated with the ability to work with little supervision, but can excel in team environments
Collaborative, opinionated, and a team player

Required Experience

Bachelor's degree in related field or 2-3 years work-related or relevant experience

Additional Information

40 hours per week, full-time position
Salary to be based on experience
Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, disability & life insurance
401(k) with employer match
Casual work environment
Paid time off and holidays
Learn more at https://www.onlinelabels.com/g... (https://www.onlinelabels.com/general/careers.aspx)

Please include your RESUME and WEB DESIGN PORTFOLIO when applying.*

Magnite is the world's largest independent sell-side platform. We were built by combining Rubicon Project's programmatic expertise and Telaria's talents in CTV. We help publishers sell advertising on their terms and connect with buyers across every channel and format. We believe in keeping tech transparent, solutions collaborative, and guidance unconflicted. The ticker symbol for the combined public entity will be NASDAQ: MGNI.

As a Front End software engineer at Magnite, you'll create and maintain experiences across many of our customer and internal-facing web apps. You'll have the opportunity to impact a number of our products, including our tools used to create and update real-time bidding (RTB) rules and our UI's used to set up private marketplace (PMP) and programmatic guaranteed (PG) deals.

We're looking for motivated, talented, and passionate people interested in joining our team of enthusiastic engineers focused on building robust, maintainable, performant, and well-documented applications.

What you will be doing:
Build complex web applications using the latest tooling and JavaScript frameworks, including React, Redux, TypeScript, Webpack, and ES6+
Work with a small team of diverse engineers distributed around the world
Write well-tested, documented, and performant JavaScript
Mentor, educate, and support those around you, and receive the same from other engineers on your team
Work in an office in the heart of LA's Silicon Beach, with unlimited snacks and a daily catered lunch
Weekly professional development training to learn new technologies, frameworks, and languages
What we look for:
You have strong JavaScript expertise and 3+ years of experience working as an engineer
You have a strong understanding of HTML and CSS
You have worked with React or another modern web application framework
You have experience shipping complex and well-tested UI's
You are an effective communicator, and have experience writing code in a team setting using source control software like Git/Github
You are excited to learn from and teach other engineers, and believe in and practice continuous learning
Bonus Points:
You have worked with distributed/remote teams
You have deployed web apps via CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Travis, etc.)
You have experience with typed JavaScript (TypeScript/Flow)
You have experience with Jest and Enzyme
You have experience with contemporary JavaScript web/build tools (NPM/Yarn, Babel, Webpack/Rollup, etc.)
You have experience with SCSS, Sass, or Less
You have experience with React Component Libraries like Ant Design, Material UI, or React Bootstrap
You have worked with project management software like JIRA, Asana, or Trello
What's in it for you:
Take time for yourself: Take what you need with our unlimited DTO program.
Stay healthy: Choose from a variety of medical, dental and vision plans to cover you and your loved ones at a very low cost
Enjoy your stay: We want to make it easy for you. Each Magnite office enjoys a variety of benefits like daily catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen with healthy snacks and free vending machines (currently we are working from home until further notice).
Be valued: At Magnite, diversity matters. We've made a commitment to fostering an inclusive and anti-racist culture through measurable action.

Job Description
Ritter Insurance Marketing is looking for a UX/UI Developer to add to their growing Software Development team. The position will be responsible for the planning, designing, testing, and modifying websites and digital media within a team environment.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Confer with marketing & communications department and management to obtain information on project scope, needs, limitations, capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces of websites and digital media.
Analyze marketing strategy, user needs, and technical requirements to determine feasibility of design along with time and cost constraints.
Collaborate with marketing and communications regarding webpage content, webpage flow, e-commerce strategies, SEO, and web traffic to hit outlined objectives.
Design, develop, and modify web development in accordance with outlined objectives.
Ensure high performing user interface and user experience for all website users and visitors.
Modify and update existing webpages to correct errors, provide a better user experience, allow webpages to interface with new software, and/or to improve its performance.
Develop and direct website testing and documentation to ensure validity and compatibility across all browsers, devices, and/or operating systems.
Develop and implement procedures for ongoing website revision.
Participate in code reviews.
Recommend and implement improvements to existing websites, e-commerce platforms, and the entire user experience.
Ensure successful deployment of webpages and all digital media.
Practice continuing education on web development, user experience, social media, and other emerging technologies.
Engage with professionals through conferences, workshops, online blogs, newsletters, and other interaction to stay current with best practices and emerging practices.

Minimum of 2 years of education in Web Design or related field, or equivalent job experience.
Thorough knowledge computers, application servers, software applications, web development best practices, and testing tools.
Understanding of software and web development life cycle.
Four or more years of moderate level website development experience, in addition to the satisfaction of education/certification requirements.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Solid analytical and technical skills.
Able to maintain a high level of confidentiality and integrity.
Able to organize, coordinate, and direct projects.
Able to use all related hardware and software.
Able to work in a team environment.

As ENGIE Resources pursues its vision of Energy Transition, significant changes are required in the way we work and the tools we use. To meet the goals of this transformation, our company needs to implement redesigned systems and processes using the latest in digital technology.

The Software Developer position requires a good technical foundation as well as a willingness to wear several hats with a strong commitment to deliver enterprise solutions. The Software Developer develops, tests, implements, integrates, deploys, maintains both off the shelf and proprietary business system platforms for ENGIE Resources.

What you’ll do:

I mplements and improves Azure tech stack for integration
Builds and supports custom applications using full stack development
Develops full stack integrations and backend services using Azure cloud resources including: Azure SQL, Table Storage, Service Bus, Functions, Active Directory/OKTA, Elasticsearch
Develops cross-browser websites utilizing HTML5 CSS/LESS/SASS/SCSS, ReactJS/AngularJS, OAuth2, REST APIs
Builds and supports the DevOps pipeline that will be used across all new projects as well as bring in existing systems to the DevOps pipeline
Strives to automate as much as possible in the build and deploy space including support for Quality Engineering and full support for CI/CD
Develops within best practices for the application development team in support of business operations
Researches and makes recommendations on software products, processes, and services in support of business effectiveness
Coordinates with analysts, designers, architects, and system owners in the testing of new software and applications
Estimates development tasks and communicates impediments when needed
Develops assignments that meet both functional and non-functional quality standards (eg. integration patterns, DevOps, patterns and practices, and architectural standards)
Develops to technical and security specifications for the targeted tasks.
Tests code via automated unit testing frameworks and possibly GUI testing frameworks meeting code coverage standards
Researches emerging technologies and prototypes solutions that can be leveraged to decrease costs and increase performance
Evaluates 3rd party services, libraries and APIs to compare functionality for solution criteria fit and supports product selection
Analyzes and resolves software defects while searching impacted solution for similar but undiscovered defects
Contributes in all agile team activities including roadmap creation, planning, problem solving, designing, coding, testing and deployment of the end-to-end solution
Breaks down requirements into granular development tasks and provides estimated hours to develop
Pursues training and education to keep skillset in line with industry standards.
Accepts and performs code reviews based on defined coding standards and contributes to coding standards

Qualifications

What you bring:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or MIS curriculum.
5+ years of experience designing and developing software solutions.
4+ years of experience working in teams of up to 8+ developers.
Responsible for delivery of 2 mid to large scale projects from ideation to operations working with Agile methodologies and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Business Analysts)
2+ years of development experience with any cloud services such as APIM, Functions, Storage/Blob/SQL, Web/Worker roles, AD, and Service Bus.
2+ years of implementation experience with the following, C#, Microsoft .NET, unit testing, Azure PaaS, Visual Studio/Code stack .
2+ years of experience with AngularJS/ReactJS, AJAX, REST, JSON/XML, CSS, and UI testing frameworks like Selenium/Jest/Puppeteer.
Knowledge of common design patterns, system integration patterns and distributed design patterns.
Ideally familiar with Behavior and Test-Driven Development.
Consulting experience strongly preferred.
Strong passion for technology. Active involvement in the technology community.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative working style

Additional Information/Conditions:

Are you motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming? As a UI/UX Developer, you would work directly with UX Designers to translate wireframes, mockups, and prototypes into clean, compliant HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and related technology. In addition, you will be a key player in building out our component library and your use of scalable and efficient code will be applied to the development of all Central web applications and products.

What will you do?
Bridge the gap between user interface design and technical implementation
Help ensure consistency in front-end code, reduction of accumulating design debt, and implementation of long-term UX strategies, such as ADA Web Accessibility Compliance and a Master Design System
Use technical expertise in translating the design to code

4-year degree in Computer Science of equivalent experience
3+ years of experience as a front-end developer

Do you live by our values of Integrity, Relationships, and Excellence?
Take responsibility for actions and outcomes
Do what you say you will do
Care, because it matters
Work as a team
Never compromise on quality

Service first mentality that takes initiative to serve others

It is the policy of Central that all recruiting, hiring, training,
compensation, overtime, job classification and assignment, facilities,
promotions, transfers, employee treatment and all other terms and
conditions of employment shall be maintained in a manner which will not
discriminate against any person because of race, color, age, sex,

What You'll Do:

In your consumer life, apps like Venmo and Zelle are making easy to pay friends and family. Unfortunately, it's extraordinarily difficult for businesses to pay other businesses for services and suppliers. That's why paper checks remain the dominant form of payment between businesses in the US and account for over $10 trillion of spend. It's inefficient and slow, but fortunately Billtrust launched a solution to digitize business-to-business payments once and for all - the Business Payments Network.

As a Senior Developer working on the Business Payments Network; you will design, implement, and support features to drive the future of B2B payments.

You will work as part of an Agile team on both front-end and back-end portions of several web-based SaaS products. You will be actively involved in ensuring we ship quality and scalable products interfacing with internal teams such as product, quality and DevOps.

Work with an experienced team leveraging SCRUM techniques building customer-facing products
Build a great user experience for our clients utilizing cloud-based microservice architecture (AWS) and related technologies
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve UI and backend software
Design performant software with a DevOps mindset that will scale as our volumes increase
Refine best practices for automated testing frameworks for integration and unit testing in order to provide the ability to measure software quality and performance
Deliver applications using an automated Docker container delivery pipeline including support post production deployment
What You'll Bring to the Team:
An attitude where no technical challenge is too great, along with a willingness to learn and apply new technologies
Demonstrated programming experience in JavaScript or TypeScript
Demonstrated ability to develop a SPA (Single Page Application) using a modern UI framework
We use Angular 7, ReactiveJS and NgRx but will consider candidates with React using Redux.
Demonstrated ability to develop RESTful services in C#/.NET
ASP.NET Core a plus
Strong understanding of relational databases and SQL
Strong understanding of Amazon Web Services
Expertise with TDD utilizing a unit test framework, such as NUnit, Karma or Jasmine
Familiarity with integration testing framework(s), with Selenium strongly desired
Experience with Agile/SCRUM processes and techniques
Ability to communicate and collaborate cross-functionally, and work well with a team-oriented environment
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience)

What You'll Get:
Competitive salary, stock options and 401(k): We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
Open PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
Paid Parental Leave: To keep our employees and their families healthy.
A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons - We enjoy friendly competition.
Casual Dress: Every day is "Casual Friday', we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.
Who We Are:

Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $30B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 19 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture - We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas – even with our CEO – and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape.
