Summary*
The Full Stack Magento Developer will provide frictionless and functional experiences for our website visitors. As a company, our top priority is delivering best-in-the-industry customer experience and the ideal candidate for this position plays a big part in this mission.
You will be working closely with a cross-functional team consisting of Marketers, Product Data Analysts and an extended team of Software Engineers to deliver new interfaces, feature updates and operational website support for our web properties. This position translates designs into functionality, functional requirements into logical code and core platforms into extendable features.
*
Design and develop both frontend and backend Magento e-commerce features using web, cloud computing and data technologies
Understand complex concepts and quick prototyping
Be self-driven to learn, push new ideas, and teach others
Work both independently and on a team
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Improve UX of existing website features and build new features
Deploy code regularly to staging environments for testing and quality assurance
Work with the broader team to make solution recommendations and provide estimates
Communicate with Marketing Team and Software Engineers on functional requirements and style guidelines
The ideal candidate will have...
PHP object-oriented programming experience
Experience customizing the frontend and backend of the Magento 2 platform
Knowledge of vanilla Magento feature set and configuration
Knowledge of Magento and PHP best practices
Competent with MySQL-based database concepts
Experience with Git version control
Strong proficiency in JavaScript
Multi-store e-commerce implementations
E-commerce data organization and relationships
Web services integrations (REST/SOAP)
Comfort working with Linux-based systems
Caching and scaling techniques
Passionate about technology with a sharp attention to detail
We require...
5+ years of experience programming in PHP 5, Java or another similar object-oriented language
4+ years knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
4+ years of MySQL or other relational database experience
3+ years of web development experience
Demonstrated experience in Magento development
Proven ability to construct scalable Magento modules
3+ years experience working with a version control system such as Git
You will really impress us if you have...
Knowledge of PCI/PA-DSS compliance issues
Experience administering LAMP stacks
Experience using Mac OS as your development environment
About Industrial Refrigeration Parts (IRP)*
Industrial Refrigeration Parts (IRP) is a wholesale distributor primarily dealing in systems and parts for ammonia-based refrigeration systems. We are local to Springfield, Missouri but sell to customers worldwide. Working at IRP means you are committed to two things: making IRP a great place to work and delivering amazing service to our customers.

Company Culture**
We are a small team and all of us do a lot of different things every day. We all enjoy working hard towards our goals and celebrating our wins. We place a very high value on teamwork, work ethic and humility.*

100% paid health, dental, and vision benefits

Labor Day and the Friday before

The week between Christmas and New Years
Thursday and Friday for Thanksgiving
4th of July
Unlimited Personal Vacation Days (subject to team preparation and approval)
Free snacks and drinks in the office
*

_To bring our team, customers, suppliers, and community members a genuinely positive experience in all that we do._

Do you want to be part of an exciting team driving innovative solutions? Do you love working with emerging technologies? We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer with a passion for creating new innovative solutions to consumer and business problems to join Epson’s Digital Innovations Team.

What you will do:
The Senior Software Engineer performs research, prototyping, design, development, integration and/or sustaining of full stack applications, for both new and existing cloud environments.

Research and comprehend contemporary concepts in computer science in order to integrate full software for mobile devices, desktop computers and the cloud. Use this knowledge to design and develop proof of concept and production web applications that interface with Epson consumer electronics devices as well as algorithms that meet and exceed performance targets.
Analyze and engineer feature requests for business teams, contribute to roadmaps for specific technologies and propose new projects to management.
Recommend optimal approaches to design and efficient implementation based on practicality, best practices, and key technology trade off decisions.
Learn and/or evaluate new software technologies
Plan, estimate, schedule and develop software that interfaces with multi function printers, iOS/Android apps, third party reference designs (e.g. Raspberry Pi), multi modal interfaces and server platforms or libraries.
Integrate Epson source code with open source software, and software produced by both Epson affiliates and third party companies.
Investigate problem reports, perform troubleshooting and recommend remedies for multiple products. Also research, install, test, evaluate and document problems in released and pre-release software from vendors.
Review software designs, source code under development by colleagues as needed.
Perform unit and integration testing or create test code for features on various platforms.
Create or update documents explaining feature implementation and usage.
Re-engineer assigned software to improve the performance, scalability, stability, and maintainability.
Utilize agile project methodologies.

What you will bring:

5-7 years experience in designing and developing software for full stack deployments specializing in backend cloud environments that connect standalone products,
Completion of an undergraduate program required. (B.A. or B.S.).
Have a general understanding of approaches in Artificial Intelligence
Experience applying Machine Learning techniques preferred
Experience working with web applications and developing software in one or more server scripting languages
Knowledge of iOS and Android app development and common libraries, object oriented software development
Experience developing multi-threaded applications, and database formats
Working knowledge of backend server application development including Google/Azure/AWS Cloud services, Software as a Service (SaaS), Python, Java, JavaScript, Node.js, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, HTTP, WebSockets and Socket.IO, SSH, SQL and NoSQL databases.
Working knowledge of RESTful architecture concepts, Docker containers, and design patterns, voice user interfaces, Python, Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Software as a Service (SaaS), MySQL or SQLite, one or more NoSQL databases, callback functions, software factories and common server frameworks and machine learning concepts are preferred.
Experience with personal assistant (Alexa, Google Assistant, Cortana, Siri) skill design capability is a plus.

NextGen Federal Systems is seeking multiple Software Engineers to support software development for a federal customer, addressing current and emerging needs for Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) applications. Selected candidates will be part of a development team operating in a dynamic, agile, fast-paced environment and provide support across the software engineering lifecycle, including design, development, integration, and testing.
Location: * St. Louis, MO (Relocation assistance available for qualified candidates)
Responsibilities: *
Utilize domain knowledge and hands-on experience to develop and implement software programs.
Create, maintain, and improve the performance of existing software code.
Write and update software code and databases.
Test and maintain software products to ensure strong functionality and optimization.
Write test scripts to use in test-driven development and agile software development environment.
Build automated procedures, in addition to functional code, to ensure continuous integration and continuous delivery of software.
Solve software development and engineering problems and recommend improvements to existing software programs.
Work effectively with peers and customer software coding teams.
Qualifications: *
Minimum of 4 years of relevant professional experience.
BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent technical degree.
Demonstrated experience in at least two of the following: Java, JavaScript, or Python enterprise application development; web services architecture, design, and development; relational database design; spatial database design; NoSQL database design; micro-service architecture, design, and development.
In-depth experience with Agile philosophies, serving as scrum or team lead.
Experience with Continuous Delivery and Continuous Integration (CI/CD) techniques, test-driven development, and automated testing practices.
Experience working with relational databases.
Work well in a team environment under evolving priorities.
Clear written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to obtain Top Secret security clearance required. Active Top Secret (or above) security clearance preferred.
Additional Desired Skills and Experience: *
Possession of any of the following: Agile Development Certification, Certified Scrum Master, Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), or Certified Scrum Professional
Experience in full-stack development to include Java, Web services, Database, and micro-service development.
Knowledge of and experience with agile and lean philosophies.
Experience customizing code, scripts, modules, macro procedures, or libraries to implement specialized spatial analysis functions using Python, Java, JavaScript, PHP, C, Perl, or similar.
Experience working independently with clients or stakeholders to develop user-stories in support of full-service consumer and business applications.
Experience integrating and tailoring of geospatial Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) software applications; developing and maintaining specialized software and databases; integrating related specialized hardware; or performing engineering studies to identify and remedy geodata processing bottlenecks.
Experience with government or commercial imagery products, to include SAR or related RADAR imaging technologies.
Experience working with and developing geospatial information systems (GIS) to include open-source and proprietary geospatial formats
Experience using and developing common geospatial tools, data, and operating platforms including: Boundless Spatial suite, Remote View, PostGRES/PostGIS, Oracle Spatial or other geospatial databases, ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Server, Image Server, and File Geodatabases tools; KML, KMZ, NITF, TIFF, JPEG, GeoPDF, and similar georelated formats and data structures; ESRI, Cesium, OpenGeo Suite, or similar operating platforms.
Experience abstracting new or legacy systems via standards-based APIs to include web services including but not limited to Open Geospatial Consortium standards.
Experience developing terrain analysis visualization and algorithms, or developing automated detection algorithms.

Value the talents and contributions of our employees as the key factor for our success.

Job Title: Software Developer Manager C# / VB.NET ASP.NET
Job Description:
Key Components to the Role: *
• Manager / Lead Developer (Hands-on Development)

• C# / VB.NET experience is a must (Minimum 8 years)

• ASP.NET / ASP.NET Core experience is a must (Minimum 8 years)

• Web API experience is a must (Minimum 8 years)

• MS-SQL experience is a must (Minimum 8 years)

• Familiarity with Object Oriented design concepts, data structures and algorithms

• Some experience in web applications / services

• Prior experience in managing a team of 5+ developers
Position Summary: *
Micrologic Associates is seeking an experienced, hands-on Software Development Manager to lead a team of developers and to help refine operational procedures within the department. At Micrologic, our software technology products are an integral part of our services & success.

Development responsibilities will include working on new system features as well as maintaining and supporting existing applications. Additionally, the Software Development Manager will assist in developing and implementing the technical strategy, development methodology, and necessary IT operational procedures to sustain a reliable set of production systems.

As a team leader within the Development team, this position will be responsible for the planning and delivery of appropriate solutions to meet required specifications and timelines and will work closely with other departments to ensure products and services meet all technical, functional, and performance related requirements.

The Software Development Manager should be a self-starter, have a can-do attitude, and possess a strong development background. This position has a strong team emphasis and will require exceptional relationship building skills with the ability to create effective partnerships with business, shared services, and other IT Support areas. This position will report to our Director of Development Services.
Responsibilities: *
• Monitor systems and applications uptime and performance with a goal of minimizing downtime

• Monitor system deployment and maintenance for impacts to production support

• Support and maintain production environments and applications

• Assist in developing the technology strategy for the organization; research and implement technical tools needed to optimize the business processes and workflows

• Review requirements and determine technical design and implementation alternatives

• Responsible for department’s technologies including JIRA, CRM and ticketing system

• Implement development guidelines and processes including coding standards, documentation and audit trail, code maintenance, peer reviews and check-in/checkout procedures

• Mentor, coach and provide technical guidance ensuring team is successful to deliver quality products

• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, recognize and react to changing business needs and effectively prioritize tasks

• Ability to meet deadlines, identify issues and resolve with minimal direction
Requirements: *
• 8-10 years of progressive broad-based information systems experience

• 5+ years of management/supervisory experience in application implementation and production support

• Experience working in SQL Server environments with strong SQL Server development skills

• Hands-on experience with many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end system

• Strong technical skills with demonstrated experience in SQL, C#, .NET

• Prior use of software tools to prototype data structures, process, and system functionality
(screens, reports, audit logs), data validation and storage logic

• Capable of providing time estimates and preparing design documents, developing, coding, and testing

• Experience with (SDLC) software methodologies such as Scrum/Agile, certification a plus

• Good understanding of Project Management Principles, certification preferred

• Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

• Ability to multi-task and manage shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment

• Drawn to both strategize and execute; moreover, able to do so successfully in a fast-paced environment.

• Superior written and verbal communication skills

• Skilled at coaching, developing, and managing early-career and more seasoned professionals

\* Must live in New Jersey or near by

Job Title: Senior Web Developer PHP/MySQL (10+ yrs exp req)
Job Description:
Yes, we are hiring, despite COVID.

About Us:

Round Sky, Inc. is an online marketing and lead generation agency that generates thousands of real-time consumer loan requests every single day of the year. You will work with smart, motivated, open-minded people who love solving challenging, real-world problems as much as you do.

Job Description:

We are looking for a talented Senior Web Developer who has extensive experience with PHP and MySQL/MariaDB in a Linux environment. In addition to being very comfortable with the backend you should be equally comfortable with the front end: JQuery and CSS. You don't need to be a web designer, but you should be able to comfortably write complex jQuery code and troubleshoot CSS.

At peak our APIs handle 200+ connections/second, in this environment mistakes are costly and time savings for code improvement are huge. Similarly our websites handle 500+ requests/second, small front end changes to speed up consumer load times are crucial. After initial training of our systems we are looking to set you free and have you architect and develop projects that we don't have enough manpower to tackle. You should be comfortable testing and re-testing your code to make sure no bugs make it into production, on many projects you will work with other developers in the company; after deployment you should be comfortable training the sales people in the company on how to use your new creations.

Responsibilities:
Architect, plan, write, and test new functionality based on guidelines from sales and management. 60% of the code will be in PHP with SQL, 40% will be with jquery/html/css.
Improve existing code base, based on changing business requirements.
Integrate new vendors and clients via their API systems.
Create API systems for third parties to plug into our system, keeping security in mind, and create human readable documentation on how to use your new API.
Plug in functionality for designer created websites, jQuery with AJAX, CSS/HTML changes, write back end code to support said AJAX requests, etc.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree from a 4 year university is required.
At least 7 years of experience with PHP + MariaDB/MySQL, 10+ years preferred.
A solid understanding of MariaDB/MySQL is preferred. Concurrency issues, reusing open sockets, optimizing queries for speed beyond indexes, etc.
A passion for code. You have dreams in PHP.
OOP programming - comfortable with classes, building code that can be modular and reused.
Knowledge of jQuery, take designer created website and plug in ajax requests, modals, validation, div/form navigation, plug ins such as charts, progress bars, etc. Ability to reverse engineer jQuery plugs in and modify them to your needs.
Ability to interface with non-IT staff, gather task requirements, then build an interface/functionality to meet their needs and train them on it.
Comfortable reading API documentation from third parties and troubleshooting and integrating into various systems.
Self Starter - someone comfortable troubleshooting tasks on their own but will also ask questions if something is out of place or an opportunity presents itself to improve a system or workflow.
Preferred skills but not required:
Linux systems administration
Docker / Kubernetes
LiteSpeed / Nginx / Apache configuration
Propel ORM
Compensation & Benefits:
Competitive Salary $65k-$110k DOE.
Health Insurance with Dental.
Company fridge full of snacks and drinks (soda, energy drinks, water, low calorie drinks, healthy drinks, etc).
On site parking.
Company weekly lunches.
Great casual office environment - you will work with other smart, motivated, open-minded people who love solving challenging, real-world business problems as much as you do.
Location:

Due to COVID we are all working remote. Your training will be done in the office however. The long term plan is to be back in the office within the next ~6 months to a year. This is a FULL TIME position in Las Vegas, NV near Townsquare / Mccarran airport.

No recruiters please.

Wily Fox Technologies is looking for curious and motivated .NET full stack developers to help our clients build custom software solutions and contribute to our software product (tinkerers at heart). The custom software projects with clients are almost always new system implementations, not maintaining systems. With new implementations, come new opportunities to learn and increase your skillset (bag of tricks).

Our client service mentality is part of why our clients seek our services, we truly feel that we can make their business better with automation and process improvement, realized through custom software solutions. We feel the benefits we deliver come from an understanding of the business need, and building something to accommodate the need.

The positions we are trying to fill are in the Sacramento area and do require people to work onsite after the COVID-19 crisis has passed, working conditions until then are remote. The positions are for mid-level and senior level candidates. Working as part of a small team, the tasks will include full-stack design and implementation of new .NET applications with MS-SQL databases. The development methodology is an agile iterative one, and the IT Group is supported by the business, with an interest in getting the new systems implemented.

We are looking for candidates with the following skills:

· At least nine (9) years of experience developing .NET applications, preferably in the health care industry

· At least three (3) years of .NET Core Experience

· At least five (5) years of MS SQL experience

Additional skills we are recruiting for include:

· At least two (2) years of experience with AWS

· Formal presentation and/or product demo experience

We value everyone in the company, fully recognizing that the success of Wily Fox depends on the talent we can attract and retain. Our flat reporting structure minimizes bureaucracy and creates an environment of collaboration, where everyone gets a chance to communicate their thoughts and be heard. Creating an atmosphere in which people can thrive and grow their skill set.

You’ll be happy you reached out to us, really…

Job Summary

Part of what makes our company unique is the integrated systems we have designed to keep our software current, innovative, and competitive. As a UI software engineer, you will take responsibility for developing & improving our UI code and implementation. In this position you will utilize your own creativity, and work closely with QA, Sales to produce a highly polished user interface. Your efforts will be used for production and mission critical operations software, that will be used by the entire company in a way that will allow us to gain a competitive edge. If you are an individual who is highly interested in technology, software development, and very detail oriented, you may be just who we are looking for to join our team.

Job Title: Lead Software Engineer - Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning System
Job Description:
Celestial Oncology Inc. is a startup developing a novel robotic system to delivery 4π radiotherapy, which promises to dramatically improve the dose distribution in radiation therapy treatments. The company is in Santa Monica, California. Celestial recently completed its series A financing and is beginning the development of the system to take it through FDA 510(k) approval. The Senior Robotics System Engineer will be responsible for the design and development of the system level robotics controls for the treatment robot and imaging robot. This responsibility also includes test and evaluation of the functional prototype, supporting integration of the robotics system with the treatment planning software, formal testing and submissions. The Senior Robotics System Engineer will work in a supportive environment provided by both an established company and a major research university.

The responsibilities include:
Lead the design, development and integration of the control systems for the treatment robot (linac) and imaging robot. This includes obstacle avoidance sensor.
Development of motion planning and integration with the TPS software development team.
Design of the registration & tracking system with the robot workspace.
Responsible for the repeatability and accuracy of the robotic system.
Responsible for designing the robot system to work in a collaborative workspace.
Documentation of the robotic system including requirements, risk analysis, system design verification, validation and reliability testing of the robotic system in support of an FDA 510(k) submission.
The requirements include:
Bachelors in EE, ME or CS. Master's degree a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in medical robotics and image-based algorithm development.
Strong track record in the areas of image-based registration of robotic workspace, motion planning and autonomous systems including forward and inverse kinematic development.
Familiarity with ISO 13485 and ISO 14971; Working in an FDA regulated environment is a must.
Theoretical and practical knowledge of classical and modern servo control systems.
Able to compute forward and inverse kinematics on multi-DOF robotic systems.
Matlab and C++ programming skills a must; embedded C programming capabilities is a nice to have.
Solidworks, Autocad Inventor or other solid modeling programs a nice to have.
Knowledge of and experience with robotic platforms or other real-time systems is required.
Passion for learning and finding the root cause of complex technical problems.

We work primarily with big enterprise companies, helping them to replatform their client-facing web applications to the modern technological stack, or build web applications for internal use. In most cases, we work with modern frameworks and tools, like Angular or ReactJS. We also use NodeJS to build a back-end for the front-end. In addition, we do performance optimization and architecture assessment. Solutions we use are based on strong engineering practices, and our company follows the best DevOps and automation practices.
You can get a unique experience working with a complex customer’s infrastructure and dealing with a high number of integrations with external systems, as these require strong architectural design skills.
Your mission will be challenging but interesting: to develop a sophisticated end-to-end system, and drive adoption of modern methodologies like Scrum, TDD, and Continuous Integration within the team.
If you are excited about all aspects of modern engineering - writing great code, creating architectures, designing components, interacting with clients, and delivering the working system to production - then you are the kind of person we are looking for. If you enjoy freedom and responsibility, creative thinking, leading, and mentoring others, come join our team of world-class developers, QA engineers, DevOps engineers, architects, and managers.
Responsibilities:
Develop clean, modular, and reusable code

Communicate effectively across desks, teams, and departments
Participate in agile development processes in SDLC, including sprint planning, iterative development, estimations, and design sessions

Deep understanding of JavaScript Core
Solid experience ReactJS
Strong markup skills (good knowledge of HTML, CSS, CSS frameworks and pre-processors, understanding of adaptive/responsive concept)
Experience with version control and bug tracking systems
Basic to Intermediate understanding of Node, Express, Loopback or equivalent
Unit testing using Jest, Enzyme, Jasmine or equivalent framework
Good communication skills
Good problem-solving skills, initiative, and intellectual curiosity
Have experience of building at least one project from scratch
Experience with rolling out at least one project to production
Experience with developing unit tests on at least one project with not less than 30% coverage
Excellent problem-solving skills, initiative, and intellectual curiosity
Would be a plus:
Experience with Cordova
Proven ability to oversee a team of 3+ developers
NB:

Placement and Staffing Agencies need not apply. We do not work with C2C at this time. At this moment, we are not able to process H1B transfers. Applicants with CPT and OPT visas are welcome to apply.

About us:
Grid Dynamics is the engineering services company known for transformative, mission-critical cloud solutions for retail, finance and technology sectors. We architected some of the busiest e-commerce services on the Internet and have never had an outage during the peak season. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Ramon, California with offices throughout the US and Eastern Europe, we focus on big data analytics, omnichannel services, DevOps, and cloud enablement.

GeneDx is a rapidly growing CAP and CLIA certified diagnostic genetic testing laboratory for molecular genetics. Our historic mission has been to make clinical diagnostic testing available for people with genetic conditions and their families. We apply cutting edge technologies that provide a wide array of molecular genetic diagnostic tests, including whole exome sequencing and next-generation sequencing panels. We specialize in genetic testing for rare hereditary disorders, but also test for common disorders. To learn more about GeneDx, please visit our website at www.genedx.com.

Role: Sr. Software Engineer

Essential Duties include:

Creates analytic solutions for clinical genetic data, including NGS, WES, and WGS sequence data; copy-number and structural variant detection; genotype-phenotype correlation
Conducts projects in support of R&D and clinical production.

Qualifications include:

MS or PhD degree in Bioinformatics or a related field
5+ years bioinformatics development experience
Proficiency in a major scripting language (Perl, Ruby, or Python)
Basic knowledge of statistics (machine learning, data mining, hypothesis testing) and R
Working knowledge of relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, or similar)
Working knowledge of command-line Linux, shell scripting, and grid computing (SLURM, SGE, LSF, or similar)
Experience with Git, SVN or other version control software preferred
Experience developing software in a team environment preferred
Software testing and validation experience preferred
Experience with NGS data and related tools (Samtools, GATK, etc.) and other genetic assay data (e.g. aCGH)

Benefits include:

Paid Time Off (PTO)
Health, dental, vision, life insurance, LT/ST disability plans
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Health Savings Account (HSA)
401K retirement savings plan with company match
Employee Discounts
Regular performance appraisals
Many promotions from within
Business casual dress code

Fast-Growing Alternative Finance Start-Up – Greenwich, CT *
THE OPPORTUNITY*
We’re a small (15 people), but now, after 9 years, well established and very successful hi-finance / alternative finance start-up in Greenwich, CT (45 mins by train from NYC), which provides unique, large-size risk transfer solutions to global banks, asset managers, corporates, and other similarly situated institutions around the world.

We're looking to find a really sharp and experienced full-stack developer to lead a ground up software development effort leveraging Appian (a low-code platform). You'd be the architect, designer, and builder.

This is an exceptional opportunity to advance and accelerate your technology career in high finance, while developing high-impact, high-visibility applications that change the way things get done. The role is best suited for an ambitious and highly-driven developer who thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced, high-stakes, merit-based environment, and who is interested in a technology-oriented career in finance with highly competitive pay.

Working knowledge of visualization platforms, such as Power BI and Tableau, a plus;
Experience in finance is a plus (especially private equity, bonds, loans, CLOs, other capital markets)
COMPENSATION*
A competitive package including annual salary and incentive bonus;
EDUCATION*
Applicants required to take a technical vetting quiz;
B.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering preferred; other related engineering and technical disciplines considered

We’re a digital company of creatives and technologists consistently winning “Best Places to Work” while delivering custom solutions for our clients. We believe our design, strategy, and technology teams working in parallel deliver the best solutions possible.

As part of our Project Delivery team, our .NET Developers play a key role in interfacing with internal teams of project managers, quality assurance engineers, business analysts, and designers on a daily basis to provide solid solutions for our client projects. Additionally, you’ll be expected to communicate directly with clients and possess the ability to tailor your conversation and content depending on who the receiving party is. The ability to articulate and express clearly and concisely technical solutions and overall status of your projects to team members and clients is paramount to your success.

If you are a local candidate in the Minneapolis area looking for your next career step and building custom solutions in a highly collaborative environment, here’s a bit more of what you’ll do:
You’ll continue to develop your .NET experience by working within our established best practices for approaching custom solutions and problems. The ability to rely on software design patterns you’ve used will set you up for success - so make sure to articulate and call out that experience if you have it. If you bring Azure development experience, even better, if not – you’ll learn.
You’ll gain additional exposure in what RBA’s high coding standards are in addition to developing analytical and problem solving skills through the building of modern web applications. You should have a strong desire to increase your ability and competencies within SQL, C#, JavaScript (added bonus for existing framework experience,) HTML, and ASP.NET. If you already have experience in those technologies, that’ll be a huge help.
You’ll work directly with business users and IT leadership so the ability to rely on strong communication skills are essential. If you couple your strong verbal skills with even better writing proficiencies, you are going to be even more successful. Articulating thoughts and updates to customers, clients, and users at all levels will be needed so having strong interpersonal and organizational skills to handle diverse situations and changing priorities is necessary.

What’s in it for you?
Our .NET Developers will work on a variety of projects with a variety of clients in different verticals. You’ll gain incredible experience pairing strong infrastructure with our front-end capabilities to build hard working and successful solutions for our clients. The growth in your ability to think critically and independently within a collaborative and helpful environment will be a huge opportunity.

Keep Exploring RBA @ rba.careers

Our individual’s unique skills and experience allow successful collaboration around our client’s problems. If you’re still not ready to apply, no worries. Feel free to explore RBA and let us know if you have any questions.
Again, local candidates only, please.

Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid Model) or Remote

At PSAI, our Front End Developers develop state-of-the-art artificially intelligent software tools that help fuel the extremely important field of digital marketing. If you are a self-motivated individual, eager to consult our UX/UI team on the best and most up to date designs for our software, while leading the direction of how they are built and how they are maintained, then please, read on.
Responsibilities
As a Front End Developer and ultimately our bridge between visual designers, back end developers, and all things marketing you will be:
Building user interfaces for a multitude of innovative SaaS and AI learning tools for Spectrum’s software tools
Consulting with New Product Development team members to determine what technologies should be utilized to build our newest products
Developing the interface of mobile and desktop applications
Creating custom solutions for our software tool platforms
Build responsive web tools and seamlessly integrate motion into our interfaces utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other programs as you see fit
Working alongside designers, production experts, web developers, and creative professionals to develop lasting solutions for our clients
Collaborate with back end developers during requirement building phase
Work with back end developers to move project along in production via sprints
Some Characteristics That Define You
As a Front End Developer, you know that your job is much more than graphic design, web development, or creative alone. You are an artist, an engineer, and multitude of other things which make you the stellar developer that you are. As such, here are just a few traits that define our Front End Developers here at Spectrum:
Developers. Design is a unique opportunity to combine the artistry and creativity of the web with the functionality and logic of a scientist and an inventor. Our front-end developers are design engineers just as much as they are artists.
Detail-Oriented. White space and themed projects are some of our best friends in the design and development department. We love to see a site come perfectly together and we know you hate to see tiny details and bad Photoshop jobs ruin a beautiful project.
Visionaries. One of the things we love about design here at Spectrum is that it’s constantly evolving. Whether you are working on a new internal software platform or innovative new client site, we are always looking for ways to improve our products and increase your knowledge base as a developer.
Curious. As developers and digital marketers, we have the unique opportunity to create interactive and functional pieces of art. As developers, we’re not only proud of those projects but curious why some are more successful than others and seek to understand which designs work best.
Business-Savvy. Beyond the wicked front end development skills you bring to the table, we also want you to consider the business implications of our websites and software tools. From the ways our team will use them to how our clients and their customers will interact with our sites, we always want you to keep the user and the business application in mind.
Required Skills and Experience
As a Front End Developer at Spectrum, you will have the ability to hone your craft and advance your core skillset; but before we can do that, here are just a few of the skills and experience you should have coming in:
A bachelor’s degree/pursuing a bachelor's degree in design, computer science, information, or a related field
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with HTML and CSS
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience with Javascript/JQuery
Expert level knowledge and firsthand experience in desktop, mobile and responsive web design
Exposure to and experience with React
Experience/familiarity with .Net/MVC/Razor and Microsoft Azure
Ability to explain and translate your work to those under you as well as in different departments
Acute eye for detail
Benefits
Being the dynamite Front End Developer that you are, we understand that in order to get the creative juices flowing you need a good work-life-play balance. To make sure that’s possible this full-time position comes with a highly competitive salary and unparalleled benefits including:
Comprehensive medical & dental insurance
Retirement planning & company matching
Remote working options
Generous PTO, including sick days & holidays
A state-of-the-art office environment
Nintendo Switch in-office gaming such as FIFA, Arms, Mario Kart, and Rocket League
Year-round gym memberships
Paid continuing education
Casual dress code
Flexible scheduling

Job Description:
Our REDI Execution Management System focuses on bringing a new level of efficiency, transparency and openness to the trading process by building a collaborative community of investors, brokers, technology firms and content providers.Through our modular, end-to-end trade management platform users can execute everything from simple single stock trades to complex strategies across markets and time zones and manage your risk throughout the trade lifecycle. Access our growing network of over 150 execution brokers to route Equities, Futures or Options orders globally, as well as dozens of integrated prime and clearing brokers through our expanding suite of middle office tools. Collaborate with our broker and vendor partners, who are able to efficiently plug into our platform to reach our community. REDI was among the industry's first providers of trading technology and has pushed the state-of-the-art forward for more than 20 years. We're building on our history of innovation to become an open, industry-backed ecosystem for the entire trading community.

As a Server-Side Developer at Refinitiv, you can find a broad variety of projects focused on low latency, high-speed financial applications written in multiple languages and on various platforms. From C++ to Java, Linux to Windows, back end database to inter-process communication, you should be confident in all tiers and have an ability to learn new skills as we evolve with the changing technology landscape.

Successful server-side developers take ownership of the products that we ship, and, as such, are expected to work with Product Management to determine business requirements, come up with high-level designs, evaluate build vs buy options, work with QA in testing, and deliver and maintain the applications in production. At Refinitiv, we value the ability to think and learn over simply being proficient in a specific language, as this allows for to be agile and adapt as needed. If this excites you, we are happy you are reading this description and invite you to continue reading!

Knowledge & Skill :
• Specialist, experienced professional with extensive knowledge and skills gained through wide-ranging experiences in a field that requires diverse practices or procedures.
• Recognized expert in their functional area or geography
• Deep knowledge of complex product, market and function in own area
• In-depth understanding of a Business Unit or function
• Works on issues of a diverse scope where analysis of situations requires skills and understanding of current industry trends

Scope of Impact :
• Leads significant projects, programs and business initiatives, demonstrating creativity and ingenuity
• Determines work priorities based on general direction from managers
• May manage budget for projects or programs within area
• Contributes to the development of new principles and concepts and Business Unit strategy
• Provides specialist advice to middle and senior management to resolve complex issues.

Strategic Planning & Decision Making :
• Applies a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions
• Anticipates customer needs; assesses requirements and identifies new solutions
• Solves complex problems which may be multidisciplinary or require an in-depth evaluation of variable factors
• Makes decisions in non-routine situations applying considerable interpretative thinking

Required Qualifications:
BS/MS in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience
3+ years of Core Java experience
Proficient in multiple platforms and operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux)
Experience working in a Test-driven development
Proficiency with Object-oriented design and design patterns (e.g. Dependency Injection, Strategy, Factory)
Hands-on experience with Build and Deploy frameworks such as Gradle, Jenkins, Artifactory, Chef, Docker
Able to understand SQL regardless of the database (e.g.. DB2, Sybase, SQL Server)
Familiarity with source control (e.g. Git/GitFlow, SVN)
Work well in a team
Strong documentation and presentation skills
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to design and defend solutions to management

Preferred Qualifications:

Trading domain knowledge (stock market, FIX, trading engines, exchanges, etc)
Agile software development process (daily huddle, sprint planning, retrospectives, etc)
Inter-process communication (TCP/IP, UDP/multicast, etc)
Testing frameworks (GoogleTest, Junit, mockito)
Some C++ skills (e.g. memory management, Boost, STL, etc.) preferred

JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW:

The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for the design, development, and release of our organization's web-based applications. The company is in the midst of a significant program to revise its core web-based business services delivery automation systems, migrating to a contemporary, open source technology stack. The Senior Software Engineer reports to the Manager/Director of Development for strategic projects, and works closely with program management to ensure successful operational deployment of new applications while maintaining business continuity of existing applications. This is a hands-on technical role, providing the opportunity to build a top class User Interface for distributed systems using standard open source technologies to build out a state of the art Human Resources, Payroll, and Benefits services delivery platform. Candidate should be highly self-motivated, hardworking, an innovator, and proactive in finding solutions.

Work closely with Program Manager and other stakeholders to develop project plans, and participates in resource planning

Experience:

• REST/SOAP/XML/JSON webservices with knowledge on integration patterns.
• Spring MVC, Spring Boot, and Hibernate.
• Demonstrated proficiency writing SQL queries in RDBMS databases such as Oracle/SQL Server.
• Demonstrated understanding of Application optimization, performance improvements and scalability.
• Demonstrated understanding of Software design principles and patterns.
• GIT source code repository.
• Agile/SCRUM methodologies.
• UNIX/Shell scripting
• Knowledge of design for scalability, performance and reliability.

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Advanced Javascript and UI development experience is a plus
• High analytical skilled, motivated and good communication skills
• Experience working in Agile/SCRUM methodologies
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and streams
• Strong collaboration skills within and external teams
• Working knowledge of messaging queues using RabbitMQ
• Experience in UNIX/Shell scripting
• Mobile development experience is a plus

The primary responsibility of the Developer position will include the effective design and development of enterprise wide database systems with specific attention on implementing inventory and work order management systems for the City of Chicago. This position will leverage Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server platforms, related data systems and management tools, and will be responsible for identifying innovative approaches and solutions in a rapid application development environment. Aptitude to work on multiple assignments simultaneously including working under pressure to meet project and task deadlines

Understanding of troubleshooting, root-cause analysis, application design, solution development, human factors/usability design, and implementation of medium sized projects

Problem-solving skills combined with analytical skills to analyze data, perform research, and diagnose and solve problems

_Opportunity to gain broad and more varied responsibilities, in a rapidly growing company. Software technical development, as well as project and team management responsibilities._*
Artaic – Company & Work Environment*
Artaic is a unique design and manufacturing firm based in Boston’s Innovation District. Artaic produces “mass customized” tile mosaics for a wide variety of applications, primarily within the commercial hospitality architecture and interior design industry. Artaic is inventing and applying a proprietary, partially automated system of front-end design software linked to back-end inventory management and robotic fabrication. This system allows for revolutionary efficiency in mosaic production (s*ee our process video at artaic.com under "Our Story").*

Artaic is ramping up sales growth and requires a *Software Engineer* who is ready to maintain Artaic’s core IT support systems and tackle new development challenges. We are a dynamic growth stage company with a demonstrated commitment to supporting new design, engineering, and business ideas while promoting an entrepreneurial culture that fosters and rewards initiative, innovation, and creativity.
The Position*
Artaic is seeking a *Software Engineer* to join our management team. An entrepreneurial team-player is needed to manage and contribute to Artaic’s robotic software and database engineering developments. We are looking for someone who enjoys solving problems and streamlining processes. We value the impact that technology and human centered design can have on all aspects of our business. This role collaborates closely with each department to enhance our established advanced manufacturing system and CRM to grow the business. This focus on a closed-loop system creates a unique opportunity to develop in an environment with a broad view of the enterprise, where the iteration loop is fast, and your impact is immediately visible.

The nature of this position is based in Boston's Innovation and Design Building and does not require traveling. The Software Engineer will report directly to the Founder/CEO (who is a Ph.D MBA mechanical engineer), for daily operations and new systems development.

We are a company of ~20 people who work together to contribute talents and energy to a growing team of professionals. The team takes pride in the exceptional product we produce for clients every day. The team is technologically savvy (Slack, GitHub, email, calendaring systems, digital work lifestyle, GDrive, custom CRM for tasking/communication etc.), hard working, fun loving and creative.
Daily Duties and Responsibilities: *
Responsibilities may encompass a diverse range of tasks including but not limited to the following:

· Assist Senior Software Engineer in management of all IT/engineering department and R&D initiatives.

· Manage CRM platform and integrations to assure mission-critical sales and production functions uptime.

· Manage and develop software systems that support the connection of disparate platforms – some internally developed and some outsourced - such as our CRM, Inventory Management, QBO, design software, etc.

· Creating and maintaining custom reporting using Google Sheets and Data Studio.

· Management of our website running on Wordpress with a custom theme and plugin along with WooCommerce items.

· Maintain and develop enhancements to our custom Chrome Extension.

HTML/CSS
Javascript/ES6
PHP

Bonus: ReactJS, VueJS, C++, Python

QUALIFICATIONS*

· Deep understanding of web development concepts and principles (i.e. HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, cross-browser support and responsive design).

· Experience with PHP, MySQL, and WordPress including custom theme and plugin development.

· Experience with a JavaScript framework like Meteor, NodeJS or, AngularJS.

· Experience developing applications using RESTful APIs.

Compensation*
Competitive compensation package includes base salary, bonus, benefits, and equity. This is a full–time salaried position at $65,000-$85,000 annual salary, commensurate with experience.

· Competitive health insurance coverage.

The Innovation Software Engineer (ISE) works at the core of the PLEXSYS disruptive innovation team. Generate detailed software design as well as implement and/or maintain code according to duties and responsibilities.
Manage and adhere to schedules, deadlines and development goals.
Other duties as assigned.

Exposure to a variety of technology tools and programming languages.
Passionate about innovation and new technologies, preferably with experience working in or with tech startups.
Creative approach to problem solving.
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirements.
Ability to work independently and in a team, take initiative, and communicate effectively.
Good communication skills with the ability to communicate a complex idea in a simple way.
Demonstrated organizational, decision-making, and communications skills.

Demonstrated critical thinking skills.
Ability to periodically travel as business needs dictate.

DESIRED

Design, develop and test applications/components. You will deliver highly tuned, testable and optimized application and database code per spec and be expected to offer alternative approaches when reviewing requirements.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders, QA and infrastructure teams throughout all phases of the software and product development lifecycle.
Stay current on technology and domain trends, frameworks and cutting-edge technology.
Contribute to architecture and design decisions.
Implement third party products needed to support systems and applications, including development toolkits.
Analyze business operations to understand strengths and weaknesses and determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.

Troubleshoot and provide technical support and solutions to users.
Prepare and update documentation for new or existing systems.
Monitor system effectiveness in satisfying user needs.

Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Information Technology preferred.
5+ years of full stack enterprise software development experience using Microsoft ASP Net Core (C#), SQL Server, Microservices architecture, WCF, XML/ Web services; RESTFUL APIs, CSS3/Bootstrap, HTML5, JavaScript, Angular, TypeScript and JSON highly desired.

Experience working in a regulated industry (e.g. Pharmaceutical, Bio-Pharmaceutical, or Medical Devices) preferred.
ERP implementation, replacement or support experience
Strong desire to learn and grow professionally.
Proficient in both front and back end web development.
Experience in implementing responsive web application using Bootstrap framework is essential.
Highly proficient in writing T-SQL queries and stored procedures.
Experience in SQL Server SSAS, SSIS and SSRS preferred.
SharePoint development experience preferred.
Mobile development experience preferred.
Experience with SaaS / PaaS environments such as Azure is preferred.

The ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project as a team.
Strong analytical, problem solving and programming skills.
Strong knowledge in data structures and algorithms.
Good understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, object oriented programming concepts and web technologies.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Experience communicating with other teams to collect requirements, review test cases and translate the product requirements to technical requirements.
The ability to work independently or as a team with the guidance of managers.
Ability to document the technical design and approach for the features developed.

The Full stack software engineer is expected to operate within the framework of Tolmar’s Core Values:
Consistently operate with the highest standards of ethics and compliance.
Take ownership of your actions, success and setbacks.
Respect each other and understand that honest collaboration is at the heart of our company success.

Embrace change with enthusiasm.

POSITION TITLE: Systems Architect/Senior Software Engineer

REPORTS TO: IT/Project Manager

SUMMARY:

This role will be responsible for the overall development, performance, and efficacy of the entire codebase.

The Systems Architect/Senior Software Engineer works collaboratively within the IT department and other business units to provide technology architectural assessments, strategies, and roadmaps for one or more projects; oversees development and implementation of programs, providing technical leadership and support to software development teams by identifying best-fit architectural solutions; and actively participates and responsible for the overall development, performance, and efficacy of the entire codebase. This role will serve as a technical liaison between the business and the project team of developers and testers, will leverage their architecture, design, and technical skills and experience to develop cost-effective and timely solutions to meet functional, code quality, and performance requirements.

This role will require thorough knowledge of AWS with web, mobile, database, and API development experience with strong attention to detail and ability to identify errors and make adjustments while contributing towards developing and adhering to best-practices for applications that are scalable, secure, reliable, and critical to the business.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITES:

Design, develop, and drive the standards, development processes, systems architectures, and design patterns to support IT and business solutions
Collaborate with business users and stakeholders through design and implementation, including needs analysis and system requirements
Define and refine methodology and standards for setup, design, and implementation of the application or technology to meet the needs of the business
Generate detailed system requirements with cost projections, cost-benefit analysis, and ROI
Coordinate with product development teams in defining project scope and approaches
Coordinate with both internal and external software development teams in implementing software applications
Propose most effective architectural solutions to meet cost, quality, and schedule requirements
Coach or mentor other developers when required to ensure quality and productivity
Work with project team to design prototypes to validate application functionality
Assist managers in analyzing project requirements and project designs
Participate in design, code, and test plan reviews as needed and provide appropriate recommendations
Analyze software issues and recommend workaround solutions
Develop best practices to ensure software functionality, usability, reliability, and availability
Respond to business queries and concerns professionally and build positive customer relationships
Assist in development of design documents, white papers, training documents, and software architectural documents

QUALIFICATIONS:

Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science or related field from an accredited academic institution preferred
7+ years of experience working in software development
3+ years of experience working in application architect role
Proficient understanding of the AWS platform including: EC2 instances, Elastic Load Balancer, ElastiCache for Redis, Beanstalk, CodeDeploy, CloudWatch, and Route 53
Proficient understanding of virtualization technologies for servers, storage, and networking
Experience with PHP development with frameworks such as Laravel, PHPUnit, PEST, Composer
Experience with JavaScript language and frameworks including Vue.js
Experience with mobile application development for iOS and Android devices including React Native framework
Experience with container systems such as Docker and Docker Compose
Experience with tools such as: Jira, Bitbucket, Git, Node
Experience with database systems like MS SQL Server and PostgreSQL
Experience with Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban
Experience working in the Healthcare domain a plus
Experience with Healthcare EDI transactions: ICD10, HL7, and FIHR a plus
Strong understanding of security, risk, compliance, disaster recovery, high availability architectures, hardware, operating systems, and networking connectivity

SKILLS:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills to ensure ability to articulate systems and application architecture to both technical developers and non-technical stakeholders
Shows initiative on assignments and professionally executes projects with very little direction, or can provide direction and leadership to technical teams
Knowledge of systems architecture

Able to provide reports and data management within tight time constraints

Nice to meet you. Here's a bit about us:
By unifying data-driven design with the latest in QR technology, Flowcode enables contactless connection with speed, security and ease. Our companion product, Flowpage, allows users to organize their digital existence in one easy landing page that tracks audience analytics. Paired together, our tech allows brands and creators to instantly connect with consumers, audiences, and fans.

Founded by the former CEO of AOL, we are a team of large company executives, startup founders, engineers, scientists, artists, and designers - who are all data obsessed. Flowcode is always looking to increase our potential as a company. We are focused on building a powerfully diverse workforce, not just because it is the right thing to do but because it expands the power of our team exponentially.

What is Flowcode?
Flowcode is the next generation of QR codes. Privacy compliant, ultra-fast scanning, and designed with intention, Flowcode is the number one trusted QR provider. Offering contactless solutions from the safety of your phone, with no app needed, Flowcode connects the real world to the online world instantly.

What is Flowpage?
Flowpage organizes all of your digital existence in one mobile-first landing page, aggregating your favorite links, social accounts, videos, and more. This creates a seamless experience for customers, followers, or fans to interact more deeply with your content, while allowing you to track audience engagement. A Flowpage can be built and customized in :60 seconds.

Our Flow Code
Team Supreme
Our team is our #1 product. We look out for each other and optimize for team success over individual success. Our diversity is a consequence of excellence.

Empower Creators
Creators are our friends (and customers). We build, design, and innovate - we create for creators, so they can create magic for the world.

Be Scientific
We believe in data over opinions, testing over guessing, and results over hierarchy. We follow the scientific method: question, research, hypothesize, experiment, observe, conclude, communicate, run it back.

Prioritize Impact
We invent technology to add meaningful value to our consumers, creators, and connections. We attack big problems with scalable solutions.

Undertalk, Overexecute
GSD. We’ll stop talking.

Flow Mode
You got this. Find your flow. Send it.

_*About Tenex *_

Tenex Software Solutions is a Tampa-based software company that is seeing immense growth! If you have the skills, we have the job for the right people.

Our award-winning Precinct Central product has been used by some of the largest local governments in the US and been acclaimed as the most user-friendly electronic voter check-in solution in the industry. Our platform continues to grow and has resulted in a few new openings.

We are interested in highly motivated individuals that are excited about learning all aspects of Computer Science/IT in a nurturing but demanding business environment. Tenex strives to be a leader in the elections domain and aspires to be 10x better than the next best.
Responsibilities *
The selected candidates will be expected to participate in the full software lifecycle of our web-based and mobile solutions with an emphasis on complex coding activities. They will need to understand large software modules, participate and contribute to design and development of user experience, and produce scalable and efficient software to accommodate massive amounts of data. Candidates will be expected to keep up with changing user requirements and fast paced agile development cycles. We are seeking people with a strong desire to grow and learn.

The major part of the assignment will be intense Development/Coding work on the Web and mobile platforms. Candidates are expected to generate quality, production-ready code based on working with a small close-knit group of architects, developers and subject matter experts in the US election market. The candidates will be expected to understand functional requirements, come up with an implementation strategy, estimate timelines, develop the software, unit test and integrate. Will be expected to learn and use life-cycle management tools for defect tracking, source code repositories etc.
Required Minimum Qualifications *
\*

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Information Technology
3+ years of Software Development experience
Agile Development experience, ability to work in a team environment
Detail oriented
Ability to multi-task and adapt to evolving project requirements
Superior work ethic and time management skills
Required Skills and Proficiency *
Web based development using a combination of .net framework, C# and MySQL database
Advanced knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL, SQLite, MySQL
Ability to develop using good relational database technologies
iOS Mobile Development Experience; Android desired
Proficient with XCode, iOS infrastructure
Embedded Device Development desired
Xamarin desired
Experience with Client-Server Architecture; Networked Application Development
Shell Scripting desired
Familiar with Microsoft TFS, Git, Subversion
Enterprise Application Development and Big Data experience desired
Tenex offers competitive pay and a very generous benefits package including health insurance, dental, life, vision and more. We encourage the learning process and support implementing fresh ideas and new technologies that would make impact in the industry.

We want team players that are committed to their career and strive for excellence and push themselves to be 10x better than the rest.
NO AGENCIES PLEASE.* Only actual job seekers need apply.
Thank you!

The Gig*
The best software engineers understand that software is creative work, whose value lies in solving real problems for real people. Sound technology decisions, well-designed architecture, and strong choice of tools are critically important, but at the end of the day, our users want something that helps them achieve their goals.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer who is passionate about creative problem solving. At Cosaic, we are building world-class solutions that defy conventional categorization. We know the outcomes we want to achieve and the value we will create for our customers, and our success is built on the hard work of an empowered team of world class architects, developers, designers, and product visionaries.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll be an integral part of the design, development, and delivery of our flagship desktop integration platform, Finsemble. You’ll work on a fully autonomous, cross functional team, and you’ll be a part of every step of the process, from identifying solutions to writing code, to shipping software to production. You’ll tackle novel challenges daily, and see the results of your work firsthand. If you’re interested in working on interesting problems, with real impact, let’s talk.
Scope*
Senior technologist on a software product team.
Key collaborator in evaluating goals, building solutions, and delivering value.
Craftsmanship*
Create work at a pace and level of quality consistent with the very best in the industry.
Define and build solutions in direct collaboration with our partners.
Impact*
Own major software initiatives from design to testing and delivery.
Serve as primary subject matter expert in key areas of our products.
Demonstrate thought-leadership in architectural approaches, tool selection, and coding standards.
What you bring*
Proven track record of successful ownership and delivery of significant software projects.
Passion for working hands-on with software engineers of all experience levels.
Growth mindset and an always-improving approach.
Ability to thrive in a fluid environment where we continually reassess opportunities.
A no-BS, just-enough-process, manage-the-work approach to getting stuff done.
What we bring*
The time, space and tools you need to pursue excellence in your craft.
Ownership of your approach in an outcomes-focused environment.
A collaborative team of creative professionals focused on excellence.
Trust that you know how, when, and where you can achieve your best work.
A safe environment where experimentation is welcome, failure is a part of the process, and good ideas are valued from anyone.
Qualifications*
A history of successful accomplishments getting big things done on small teams.
A high degree of competency working in Javascript or similar development language.
The ability to diagnose software issues and propose pragmatic solutions without getting bogged down.
Experience with integrated systems.
UX proficiency and comfort with front end programming.
Nice to have*
Some great Github projects to share.
Functional and Logic programming.
Experience working with Electron or Chromium.
Benefits of Working at Cosaic*
Remote First flexible working culture.
Great offices in Charlottesville, VA, New York City, and London, if co-located work is your preference.
Unlimited PTO.
Generous benefits package.
Flat organizational structure, autonomous teams, and minimal management process.
Why Cosaic?*
As a growth-stage company we offer the dynamism of a startup with the stability that comes with success. We offer very competitive salaries, medical/dental/vision coverage, generous vacation time, flexible work hours, and free lunch and cold brew daily (when we’re working from an office). Our headquarters are located in downtown Charlottesville and we have offices in New York, London, and Hong Kong. We were recently recognized as the Business of the Year by the Charlottesville Business Innovation Council and rated the #4 Top Place to Work by C- VILLE Weekly. We have also been honored as a Great Place to Work by the Great Place to Work Institute (April 2020 - April 2021).

We’re an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. In recruiting for our team, we welcome candidates from all backgrounds and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, political affiliation, national origin, religion, age, equal pay, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by law or regulation in the locations where we operate.

At Cosaic, we believe that when people feel respected and included they can be more creative, innovative, successful, and resilient. A safe, welcoming, equitable environment unlocks this potential, enabling us to do our best work for Cosaic, our customers, partners, and communities.

At Raytheon Technologies (RTX), we are defining the future of aerospace and defense with ambitious technologies that push the limits of known science. Our technologies help our customers take on the world's biggest challenges.

Job Summary:
We are currently seeking a Software Engineer to join the Missile Defense & Surveillance Software Department in Huntsville, Alabama.

Our software teams employ disciplined software processes (CMMI Level 5) across the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). We use a variety of development methodologies and tools to produce high quality products for our customers. We strive for technical excellence by drawing upon a diverse workforce whose knowledge base covers the complete spectrum of modern computing languages and platforms. The successful Software Engineer will be integrated into a small to medium-sized team performing software development, integration, and testing of real-time systems. As the Software Engineer, you will be responsible for hands-on technical work including designing, implementing, debugging, and resolving problems with real-time software applications, as well as supporting software verification efforts.

Our software applications are developed using C++, Java, and Ada programming languages executing on a variety of computing platforms running Linux/Unix operation systems.

The ability to obtain a SECRET Security Clearance is required.

Required Skills/Experience:

•18 months + experience, post-college, in object-oriented software development, using C++, Java, and/or Ada as well as Linux/Unix operating systems.
•Established verbal and written communication skills. Works within a team construct to achieve program success.
•Experience in the code and test phases of Software Engineering. Familiarity with the Software Development Life Cycle.

This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance. Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.

Required Education (including Major):
•BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Software Engineering, or relevant engineering discipline

Desired Skills/Experience:

•2 yrs of prior object-oriented software development experience using C++, Java, and/or Ada as well as Linux/Unix operating systems.
•Real-time OS, preferably WindRiver Linux or LynxOS
•Scrum Master / Product Owner experience
•UML and preferably Model Driven Development using Rhapsody
•Agile software development
•Automated testing, continuous integration
•Standard MS-Office tools for word processing, spreadsheets, and presentations
•SEI CMMI model
•Machine Learning, Cyber, and/or Artificial Intelligence techniques
•Active Security clearance at the Secret level

KEYWORDS: software, engineer, object-oriented, java, ada, linux, unix, c++, real-time, uml, code, test, agile

The Auctane Engineering Operations team is empowered with providing a world class software production system. This team ensures that our customers experience a fast and reliable system and provides our engineering teams with the tools to deploy, monitor, and maintain our production systems.

The Senior Software Engineer to our team to help us provide real-time solutions for our customers when they need it the most. Being responsible for the design and implementation of new product features and enhancements with guidance and input from other team members

Constructively engage with team members and management through open and active communication channels when problem solving and developing solutions, recommending changes in policies, procedures, and tooling.
